title: Jakarta Composite Index Rises 2.37% Despite Foreign Investors' Net Sell.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) rose 2.37% to 6,531.39, led by top gainers such as PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), which increased 4.63% and contributed 26.12 points to the index. Despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 77.90 billion, the JCI saw a significant gain, with most sectoral indices ending in positive territory, led by the technology sector with a 5.94% increase.

title: Multiple investors make significant changes to their shareholdings in various Indonesian companies.
body: PT MD Entertainment Tbk (MDEN) saw two major investors, Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi and PT Samuel Sekuritas Indonesia, sell a combined 91.57 million shares, reducing their stakes to 5.84% each, while PT Morgan Stanley Co International Plc (MS) increased its stake to 11.56% through a 1.35 million share purchase. Meanwhile, other notable transactions included PT Nippon Indosari Corpindo Tbk (NIPS) buying back 1.42 million shares, PT Nev Stored Energy acquiring 55 million shares of PT Green Power Group Tbk, and PT Indovest Central selling 2.5 million shares of PT Charnic Capital Tbk.

title: PT Bumi Serpong Damai Prepares Funds to Repay Bonds Worth IDR 610.75 Billion Due in 2025
body: PT Bumi Serpong Damai Tbk (BSDE) has set aside funds to repay its IDR 610.75 billion sukuk ijarah bonds maturing on April 7, 2025, with a principal amount of IDR 547.25 billion and IDR 63.50 billion, and an interest rate of 6.75% per year. The company's financial statements as of September 2024 show it has IDR 8.07 trillion in cash and cash equivalents, and its stock price rose 0.60% to IDR 845 per share on Wednesday, despite a 16.75% decline over the past year.

title: PT Metrodata Electronics TBK Expects 13-14% Profit Growth in 2024
body: PT Metrodata Electronics Tbk (MTDL) projects a 13-14% profit growth in 2024 compared to 2023, driven by strong sales of Infinix brand smartphones and growth in consumer, commercial, and solution consulting sectors. The company expects revenue to reach IDR 25 trillion in 2024, with a 14% growth achieved in Q3 2024, despite a decline in consulting artificial intelligence sectors.

title: Retailers in Indonesia Continue Promotions Ahead of Eid al-Fitr Holiday Amidst Concerns Over Low Consumer Demand
body: Retail issuers in Indonesia, such as Mitra Adiperkasa (MAPI) and Ace Hardware Indonesia (ACES), are continuing their discount programs to boost sales ahead of the Eid al-Fitr holiday, despite a 6-18% price increase in fast-moving consumer goods. Analysts at Bri Danareksa Sekuritas recommend buying these retail issuers, citing potential growth in the 2025 financial year, although they also express concerns over low consumer demand and purchasing power.

title: Old Oil Palm Trees Found to Have High Economic Value in Producing Liquid Sugar
body: Researchers have discovered that old oil palm trees, typically considered unproductive, can be used to produce liquid sugar, with each tree yielding 100 liters of sap that can be processed into a valuable product, potentially generating significant income for smallholders undergoing replanting. With 60 million old oil palm trunks available, the potential production of liquid sugar is estimated to be 10.8 billion liters per year, offering a lucrative opportunity for smallholders and the oil palm industry as a whole.

title: Palm oil production increases to meet global food demand, with Indonesia and Malaysia being the largest producers.
body: Global palm oil production is expected to grow 1.7% per year until 2050, with Indonesia (world's largest producer and exporter) and Malaysia (world's second largest producer and exporter) accounting for around 85% of global supply, contributing significantly to their national economies. The industry has created a big multiplier effect, employing millions of workers and developing infrastructure, with palm oil being a more environmentally friendly option compared to other vegetable oils, producing up to nine times more oil per hectare per year.

title: Indonesia wins WTO dispute against EU's discriminatory palm oil policies.
body: Indonesia has won a trade dispute against the European Union at the World Trade Organization, with the WTO panel ruling that EU policies on palm oil-based biofuels were discriminatory and inconsistent with WTO rules. The decision is a significant victory for Indonesia, ensuring fair trade practices and potentially boosting its palm oil exports, with the EU required to adjust its policies to comply with WTO agreements.

title: Indonesia to Need Additional 2.3-4.6 Million Hectares of Oil Palm Plantations to Meet Biodiesel Program Demands
body: Indonesia's mandatory biodiesel program will require 17.9 million tons of crude palm oil (CPO) for B50, 21.5 million tons for B60, and 35.9 million tons for B100, necessitating additional land areas for oil palm plantations. The government has prepared an incentive of around Rp47.1 trillion for the mandatory biodiesel program, which aims to reduce Indonesia's reliance on oil fuel imports and achieve energy self-sufficiency.

title: Indonesian Government Updates Mineral and Coal Price Reference Guidelines Effective March 1, 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has issued a new regulation, effective March 1, 2025, to stabilize the prices of mineral and coal commodities in the global and domestic markets, with the benchmark prices for mineral and coal to be updated every two weeks. The regulation aims to ensure that companies selling mineral and coal commodities adhere to the benchmark prices, with the goal of increasing compliance and understanding among companies.

title: Wealth of Indonesian Conglomerates Significantly Decreases Amid Market Correction
body: Prajogo Pangestu, founder of Grup Barito, remains the richest person in Indonesia, according to Forbes as of March 5, 2025, despite a significant correction in the stock market that reduced the wealth of Indonesian conglomerates. Low Tuck Kwong, founder of Bayan Resources (BYAN.JK), holds the second position in the list of the richest individuals in Indonesia.

title: Technology Stocks Become Favorites Amidst Indonesian Stock Market Correction
body: Technology stocks have become the favorite among market players amidst the correction in the Indonesian stock market, with prices surging by hundreds of percent, while most stocks in the Jakarta Composite Index have been sluggish. This trend has led to a significant increase in value for tech companies, outperforming the broader market.

title: Unit-Linked Insurance Products Face Challenges in 2025 Amid Sluggish Stock Market Conditions
body: The appeal of unit-linked insurance products is expected to remain weak in 2025 due to the sluggish stock market conditions, posing a challenge to their attractiveness to potential customers. The executive director of the Life Insurance Industry Association, Togar Pasaribu, predicts that unit-linked products will continue to face difficulties this year, with their performance unlikely to improve compared to 2024.

title: Indonesian Government Blocks Access to DigitalOcean's Cloud Storage Service Due to Illegal Online Gambling Content.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Communication and Digital blocked access to DigitalOcean's (DOCN) cloud storage service, DigitalOceanSpaces, due to the discovery of online gambling content on several subdomains, violating digital service laws. The blockage aims to prevent the spread of illegal and negative content, highlighting the potential risks of cloud storage services being misused for illicit activities.

title: Minister of Manpower to Announce Regulations on Online Ojek Drivers' Holiday Allowances Soon
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Manpower is set to announce a new regulation on holiday allowances for online motorcycle taxi drivers, with a proposal for application companies to provide cash-based THR (Tunjangan Hari Raya) to their driver partners. The government aims to ensure meaningful participation from stakeholders in shaping this new policy, which is currently being discussed.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Establishes 77 National Strategic Projects to Reduce Poverty and Boost Sustainable Growth.
body: President Prabowo Subianto has established 77 strategic national projects, outlined in the 2025-2029 Medium-Term National Development Plan, aiming to reduce poverty, improve human resources, and achieve sustainable high growth. The plan is expected to drive economic growth and development in Indonesia, with no specific financial metrics or targets mentioned.

title: Indonesian Mutual Fund Industry Performance Remains Sluggish Amid Volatile Financial Market Conditions
body: As of February 28, 2025, Indonesia's mutual fund industry remains sluggish, pressured by volatile financial market conditions, with fixed-income index returning 1.33% year-to-date and money market index returning 0.85% year-to-date. Meanwhile, mixed and stock mutual funds have corrected by 4.48% and 9.72% year-to-date, respectively.

title: Asosiasi Pemasok Energi Mineral dan Batubara Requests Six-Month Transition Period for Implementation of Coal Reference Price Policy.
body: The Indonesian Coal Mining Association (ASPEBINDO) is requesting a six-month transition period for the implementation of the benchmark coal price as a reference price for coal export transactions, citing the need for adjustments to ensure the policy's effective implementation without disrupting business continuity and export stability. This transition period is crucial for the Indonesian coal industry to remain competitive in the global market.

title: Rupiah strengthens against US dollar in Wednesday's trading, gaining 0.81% to Rp 16,313 per dollar.
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.81% to Rp 16,313 per US dollar in spot markets and 0.43% to Rp 16,371 in Bank Indonesia's Jisdor, driven by a weakening US dollar amid investor concerns over potential retaliatory tariffs from Canada and China. The rupiah's gain is seen as a positive development, with no specific company metrics mentioned in the article.

title: Medco E&P Discovers Hydrocarbons at West Kalabau-1 Exploration Well in South Sumatra.
body: PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has discovered hydrocarbons at the West Kalabau-1 exploration well in the Rimau block, South Sumatra, through its subsidiary PT Medco E&P Rimau, indicating that mature basins in Indonesia still have potential for development. This achievement reflects Medco Energi's continued focus on safe, efficient, and responsible exploration and production activities.

title: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya's Expansion Strategy Beyond Java Island Supports Long-Term Prospects Amidst Buying Power Challenges
body: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (AMRT) is expected to achieve long-term growth through its expansion strategy outside of Java, despite challenges in purchasing power. Associate Director Research Investment at Pilarmas Investindo Sekuritas, Maximilianus Nico Demus, is optimistic about AMRT's prospects, forecasting growth in 2025.

title: Venture capital industry performance improves in early 2025 despite lingering tech winter threats.
body: Venture capital industry performance improved in early 2025, with financing reaching IDR 15.81 trillion in January, a 3.5% year-over-year contraction, an improvement from the 8.6% decline in December 2024. Despite this, the industry still faces the threat of a "tech winter", which could impact its growth.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Rejects Power Wheeling Concept in New and Renewable Energy Bill
body: President Prabowo Subianto has rejected the concept of power wheeling, which would allow private companies or independent power producers to build power plants and sell electricity directly to consumers through the PLN transmission network. The rejection may impact the development of Indonesia's electricity system, with potential implications for the country's energy sector and related companies, such as PLN (none).

title: Government Revives Coal Gasification Project to Produce Dimethyl Ether as LPG Substitute
body: The Indonesian government, led by President Prabowo Subianto, is reviving 21 downstream projects, including four projects to convert coal into dimethyl ether (DME) as a substitute for liquefied petroleum gas (LPG), with coal being the most prominent commodity. The projects aim to reduce dependence on LPG and promote energy self-sufficiency, with no specific financial metrics or investment values mentioned.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 2.37% Despite Foreign Sell-Off
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 2.37% to 6,531.39 on Wednesday, despite foreign investors selling Rp 78 billion worth of shares throughout the trading session. The index's gain was a significant rebound from the previous day's decline, marking a volatile trading period.

title: Yen Becomes Best-Performing Currency with 4.53% Appreciation Against Indonesian Rupiah.
body: The Japanese yen (JPY) became the best-performing currency, with the JPY/IDR pair strengthening 4.53% to 110.23, followed by gains in other currency pairs, including GBP/IDR, CHF/IDR, SGD/IDR, and USD/IDR, which rose 3.22%, 2.88%, 2.24%, and 2.09%, respectively. The currency fluctuations resulted in significant changes in exchange rates, with the USD/IDR pair reaching 16,596.

title: ABM Investama's subsidiary completes share sale agreement with Citra Tubindo.
body: PT ABM Investama Tbk (ABMM) has announced the completion of the share sale agreement between its subsidiary, PT Cipta Krida Bahari, and PT Citra Tubindo Tbk (CTBN), where CKB will acquire 99.94% of CTBN's shares. The deal marks a significant milestone for ABMM, solidifying its position in the industry.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rebounds with 2.37% Gain Despite Foreign Investors' Net Sell.
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) surged 2.37% to 6,531.39 on Wednesday, rebounding from a sharp decline the previous day, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 78.34 billion across all markets. Analysts provided recommendations for stocks, suggesting the IHSG could strengthen further.

title: Superior Prima Sukses Targets Double-Digit Growth This Year Following Factory Capacity Upgrade.
body: PT Superior Prima Sukses Tbk (SUPER) targets double-digit growth in performance this year, driven by the completion of its factory capacity expansion in the middle of last year, which is expected to reach full utilization and have a positive impact on performance. The company's corporate secretary, Bles Andrew, is optimistic about the growth prospects, citing the increased capacity as a key factor.

title: PT Essa Industries Indonesia Allocates $20 Million for Capital Expenditure This Year
body: PT Essa Industries Indonesia Tbk (ESSA) has allocated around $20 million for capital expenditure this year, which will be used for a scheduled turnaround or routine maintenance of its ammonia plant in Q4 2025. This investment is expected to support the company's future operations and growth.

title: Indonesian Sharia Banks See Significant Growth in Mobile Banking Transactions
body: PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BSI) has seen a 45% increase in users to over 3 million, with transaction frequency growing 165% to over 40 million in January 2025, driven by the innovation of its super app Byond. Meanwhile, Bank BCA Syariah has also reported a 42.8% annual increase in digital transactions to 14.1 million in 2024, with its customer base growing 14.5% annually, following the launch of its new mobile banking app BSya.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 2.37% to 6,531.4 Despite Weekly and Yearly Declines
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 2.37% or 150.99 points to 6,531.4 on Wednesday, despite fluctuating in the first week of March and dropping 1.13% in the last week, and 7.75% since the beginning of the year.

title: Indonesian banks expect 20-30% increase in digital transactions during Ramadan and Lebaran.
body: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) expects a 30% increase in digital transactions during Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr this year, driven by increased online shopping, money transfers, and zakat payments. Meanwhile, PT Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) and PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BNI) also anticipate a 20% and unspecified increase in digital transactions, respectively, and are taking measures to ensure smooth transactions, including infrastructure upgrades and system testing.

title: Idul Fitri Celebrations Expected to be Dampened by Economic Woes
body: As Indonesia approaches Idul Fitri, the country's economy is expected to be sluggish, with real sales index growth slowing to 0.4% in January 2025, and household savings decreasing by 2.6% year-on-year, indicating weakened consumer purchasing power. The government is urged to quickly provide economic stimulus through budget allocation and social assistance to support households and industries, as the economy is unlikely to grow more than 5% in Q1 2025.

title: Bank Credit through Buy Now Pay Later Products Sees Significant Growth Ahead of Lebaran.
body: In January 2025, Indonesia's Financial Services Authority reported a 46.45% growth in paylater credits issued by banks, reaching Rp 22.57 trillion from 22.44 million user accounts. This significant growth is driven by increasing demand for loans from the public, with banks aggressively promoting paylater products ahead of the Lebaran holiday season.

title: Cerestar Indonesia Expects Bright Prospects for Animal Feed Business This Year
body: PT Cerestar Indonesia Tbk (CERS) expects its animal feed business to remain promising this year, driven by high demand for processed food from poultry such as chicken. The company's Chief Financial Officer, Trgu Mulyadi Chandra, believes that the need for animal feed will continue to support the business's prospects.

title: New Regulation Requires Exporters to Keep 100% of Natural Resource Export Earnings in Domestic Financial System for at Least a Year
body: The Indonesian government has introduced a new regulation, Government Regulation No. 8 of 2025, which requires exporters to place 100% of their natural resource export earnings in the domestic financial system for at least one year, starting March 1, 2025, a significant increase from the previous 30% requirement. This new regulation also extends the storage period from three months to 12 months, aiming to boost the country's economy and investment.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Discusses Opening Broker Codes and Investor Addresses on Online Trading Platform with Financial Authorities.
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) is discussing with the Financial Services Authority (OJK) to open broker codes and investor domicile displays on online trading platforms, with IDX Director of Trading and Membership Regulation, Irvan Susandy, explaining that IDX is proposing a non-real-time opening of broker codes and domicile to OJK. This move aims to enhance transparency and accessibility in the Indonesian stock market.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Remains Sluggish with 7.75% Correction in 2025.
body: The Indonesian stock market remains sluggish, with the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) correcting 7.75% year-to-date to 6,531.39 as of Wednesday's close. Despite this, corporations in Indonesia remain undeterred in seeking funding in the capital market.

title: Rupiah's weakening against the US dollar affects Indonesian stock market performance.
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.81% against the US dollar on Wednesday, reaching Rp 16,313 per dollar, but has weakened 0.70% since the start of 2025, causing volatility in the performance of several listed companies on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. The rupiah's fluctuation has affected the financial metrics of these companies, highlighting the impact of currency exchange rates on their performance.

title: Indonesia's Economic Growth in Q1-2025 Expected to be Sluggish Despite Ramadan and Idul Fitri.
body: (Note: There are no company names mentioned in the article, so there is nothing to format as 'Company Name (TICKER)'.)

title: Rupiah exchange rate still under pressure, may impact 2025 state budget.
body: The Indonesian rupiah exchange rate is still at risk of experiencing pressure, which may impact the 2025 state budget, with the current rate at Rp 16,445 per US dollar, weaker than the assumed rate of Rp 16,100 per dollar in the 2025 state budget. Despite a 0.21% increase or 35 points on Tuesday's spot market trading, the rupiah's value remains under pressure.

title: PT Bukit Asam Tbk supports government's policy on coal reference price benchmark for exports starting March 1, 2025.
body: PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) supports the Indonesian government's policy to implement a coal reference price benchmark for exports starting March 1, 2025, aiming to maintain competitiveness in the international market and optimize state revenues. However, business players are facing challenges in implementing the policy, citing concerns over contract renegotiations, convincing overseas buyers, and legal aspects, which could impact Indonesia's coal exports and revenue.

title: Indonesian Government Prioritizes Critical Minerals Development to Support Energy Transition and National Economic Sustainability
body: The Indonesian government has prioritized the development of critical minerals, such as nickel, to support its energy transition towards net zero emissions, with four priority programs aimed at strengthening national independence and economic sustainability. The government is also exploring other critical minerals, with Indonesia being the largest producer of nickel and having potential for more types, aligning with the president's Astacita agenda.

title: Indonesia's Sovereign Wealth Fund Danantara to Unveil Organizational Structure and Advisory Board Next Week
body: Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, Danantara, aims to secure $20 billion in initial funding and plans to manage $900 billion in assets, primarily sourced from state-owned enterprises, to reinvest in strategic sectors such as renewable energy and green economy. The fund, led by CEO Rosan Roeslani, will also serve as an alternative funding mechanism for major government projects, reducing reliance on the state budget and fostering sustainable economic development.

title: Indonesian Beverage Producers Fear Sugary Drink Excise Will Lead to Layoffs Amid Weakening Purchasing Power
body: Indonesian soft drink producers fear that the upcoming sugary drink excise tax, set to take effect in the second half of 2025, will lead to layoffs and further weaken the industry, which is already struggling with low purchasing power and a 0.48% month-to-month deflation rate. The industry is hoping for a delay in the excise tax, which aims to discourage sugary drink consumption and prevent diabetes, and is urging the government to consider a taxation scheme that protects the industry while achieving its health goals, with estimates suggesting that a 20% price increase could save the country Rp 40.6 trillion in diabetes treatment and lost productivity costs.

title: Multiple factories in Indonesia shut down operations and conduct mass layoffs in 2025 due to financial difficulties and declining market demand.
body: Several major Indonesian companies, including Sritex (SRTEX), Sanken Indonesia, Yamaha Music, Tokai Kagu, Danbi Internasional, and Bapintri, have shut down operations or are set to close, resulting in over 14,000 layoffs, due to financial difficulties, declining market demand, and strategic decisions by parent companies. The wave of factory closures and mass layoffs in 2025 highlights the growing difficulties faced by Indonesia's manufacturing industry, with factors such as global competition, shifting market trends, and financial constraints contributing to the struggles.

title: Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund sets sights on global acquisitions to expand investment portfolio and strengthen economic resilience.
body: Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara (DANANTARA), aims to manage $900 billion in state-owned enterprise assets and invest $20 billion to improve budget efficiency and accelerate economic transformation. The fund plans to expand its investment portfolio through global acquisitions, with a goal of becoming a major player in the industry, while addressing public concerns over mismanagement and ensuring the separation of funds.

title: Foreign Investors Record Net Sell of 29.38 Million Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Foreign investors on the Indonesia Stock Exchange recorded a net sell of 29.38 million shares, with PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) experiencing the largest net sell of 405.09 million shares, followed by PT Bank Artha Graha Internasional Tbk (Bank Artha Graha) with a net sell of 36 million shares. On the other hand, PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BUMI) saw the largest net buy of 130.44 million shares, followed by PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk (MRDK) with a net buy of 67.50 million shares.

title: Jakarta Composite Stock Price Index Rises 1.32% to 6,617.85, Driven by Gains in Banking and Renewable Energy Stocks.
body: The Jakarta Composite Stock Price Index surged 1.32% to 6,617.85, driven by gains in PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII), and PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN), with BBRI and DCII contributing 16.90 and 16.83 index points, respectively. Despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 36.91 billion, analysts believe the recent decline in the index is nearing its end and has potential for a significant rebound.

title: PT Dharma Polimetal's 2024 profit declines 5.3% despite strong export growth and improved gross profit margin.
body: PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk (DRMA) reported a 5.3% year-on-year decrease in profit in 2024, with revenue slipping 0.6% to IDR 5.5 trillion, despite a 40-fold surge in export revenue and a 3% growth in gross profit. The company aims to strengthen its global market potential and expand exports through its joint venture, PT Dharma Kyungshin Indonesia, and is building a new factory with 1.5 times greater capacity, scheduled to be completed in the second half of 2025.

title: MB Investment Management increases stake in PT ITSEC Asia Tbk through share purchase transaction.
body: MB Investment Management Pte Ltd increased its stake in PT ITSEC Asia Tbk (CYBR) by purchasing 100,000 shares at IDR 590 per share, raising its total shares to 1.77 billion. Meanwhile, Commissioner Andri Hutama Putra sold 1 million shares at IDR 605 per share, reducing his shareholding to 35.5 million shares, with the company's shares closing at IDR 620 per share, down 1.59% from the previous day.

title: Garuda Indonesia and Citilink prepare 1.9 million seats for Eid 2025 peak travel season.
body: PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA) and its subsidiary PT Citilink Indonesia have prepared a total of 1.9 million seats ahead of the peak travel season for Eid 2025, marking the largest capacity offered by GIAA in the past three years. The additional 341 flights, comprising 315 extra Garuda Indonesia flights and 26 Citilink flights, aim to meet high demand on popular routes, ensuring optimal air travel accessibility during the Eid holiday period.

title: Oil palm plantations not main driver of deforestation in Indonesia, study reveals.
body: Indonesia's oil palm plantations have grown significantly over the past 30 years, but they only account for 15% of the country's total deforested land, with the majority of deforestation occurring due to other economic activities such as logging and agriculture. The Indonesian government has implemented measures to improve palm oil governance, including a moratorium on new oil palm plantations, to ensure sustainable development and uphold zero-deforestation commitments.

title: Several listed companies plan to buy back their shares amid declining stock prices.
body: Several listed companies in Indonesia are planning to conduct share buybacks, a move designed to counter the downward trend in the composite stock price index, which has fallen 6.53% year-to-date as of March 6, 2025. This buyback trend is seen as a positive development amidst the current market conditions.

title: Indonesian Motor Vehicle Insurance Industry Struggles Amid Weak Automotive Market.
body: The Indonesian automotive insurance industry is struggling due to a sluggish automotive market, with premium income growth slowing to 3.3% in 2024, reaching IDR 20.14 trillion, the smallest growth since 2020. The industry is expected to face continued challenges as weakened purchasing power is expected to affect vehicle demand throughout the year.

title: Eramet Indonesia Explores Investment Opportunities in Nickel Mining and Electric Vehicle Battery Sectors.
body: Eramet Indonesia has expressed interest in exploring investment opportunities in Indonesia's nickel mining and electric vehicle battery sectors, following a discussion between Eramet Group CEO Christel Bories and Indonesian Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto in Paris. The potential investment could bring significant economic benefits to Indonesia, although no specific financial metrics or timelines have been disclosed.

title: Indonesian Commercial Vehicle Sales Decrease 4% in January 2025 Amid Industry Uncertainty
body: In January 2025, wholesale sales of commercial vehicles, such as trucks, reached 4,650 units, a 4% decrease from 4,839 units in January 2024, according to the Indonesian Automotive Industry Association. Despite this decline, some commercial vehicle brand agents are targeting growth opportunities, as the national automotive industry remains vulnerable at the start of 2025.

title: PT Multipolar Technology records significant 64.35% increase in net profit to Rp 368.88 billion in 2024.
body: PT Multipolar Technology Tbk (MLPT) reported a significant 64.35% increase in net profit to IDR 368.88 billion in 2024, driven by a 13.12% growth in net sales to IDR 3.72 trillion. The company's revenue was led by its technology services segment, which contributed IDR 1.50 trillion, followed by sales of hardware products and supporting services, and IT outsourcing.

title: Garuda Metalindo Aims to Boost Performance in 2025 by Strengthening Local Sales and Expanding Globally.
body: PT Garuda Metalindo Tbk (GMFI) aims to boost its performance in 2025 by strengthening local sales and expanding globally, driven by growing demand for automotive components in the original equipment manufacturer segment. The company sees potential growth opportunities from new customers and new component developments, despite risks of weakening national car sales.

title: Metland Prepares to Develop Six Star Hotels Across Indonesia This Year
body: PT Metropolitan Land Tbk (MLTA) is preparing to develop six star-rated hotel projects this year, including Metland Hotel Bekasi, Metland Hotel Cirebon, and Hotel Horison Ultima Seminyak Bali, among others. The company aims to expand its hotel business, with details of the projects to be revealed in the coming months.

title: Indonesia's Plan to Export Renewable Energy to Singapore Expected to Generate Additional Revenue of Up to $4.2 Billion Per Year
body: Indonesia's plan to export renewable energy to Singapore is expected to generate an additional $4.2 billion to $6 billion in foreign exchange and $210 million to $600 million in tax revenue per year. The export of 3.4 gigawatts of electricity at a tariff of $0.014 to $0.020 per kilowatt hour could also lead to significant additional revenue for the country, which could be used to fund renewable energy projects.

title: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources extends copper concentrate export permit for PT Freeport Indonesia until June 2025.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has issued Regulation No. 6/2025, extending the copper concentrate export permit for PT Freeport Indonesia (IDX: FPID) until June 2025, revising the previous regulation to address the company's challenges. This move aims to prevent production disruptions and potential layoffs in the mining sector, allowing Freeport to continue operating without interruptions.

title: Pertamina Assures Public of Fuel Quality Amid Allegations of Pertamax Oil Tampering.
body: PT Pertamina (PERT) has faced allegations of corruption and fuel adulteration, particularly with regards to Pertamax fuel, but the company's director, Simon Aloysius Mantiri, has reassured the public that the fuel distributed at its gas stations meets government-set quality standards. Pertamina has conducted testing at 75 points, including its Plumpang terminal and 33 gas stations in the Jakarta area, to ensure the quality of its fuel products.

title: Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources Releases Regulation on Renewable Energy Power Purchase Agreement Guidelines.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has released Regulation No. 5/2025, which provides guidelines for power purchase agreements from renewable energy power plants, allowing for contract periods of up to 30 years and outlining payment mechanisms and electricity pricing. This regulation aims to accelerate the development of renewable energy for electricity provision, with potential benefits for companies such as PT PLN (PT PLN).

title: Multifinance Industry Faces Rising Credit Risk and Increasing Non-Performing Financing Ratio in 2025.
body: Indonesia's multifinance industry faces the threat of rising non-performing financing (NPF) this year, with the NPF ratio increasing to 2.96% in January 2025 from 2.70% in December 2024, according to the Financial Services Authority. As a result, provisioning by leasing companies is also expected to rise, posing a challenge to the industry's financial metrics.

title: Indonesian Stock and Balanced Funds Continue to Show Negative Performance in Early 2025.
body: The performance of equity and balanced mutual funds in Indonesia remained negative at the start of the year, with the Infovesta 90 Equity Fund Index dropping 8.89% and the Infovesta 90 Balanced Fund Index falling 4.35% month-over-month in February 2025. Despite this, there is still a chance for recovery, driven by various sentiments, according to data from Infovesta.

title: Rupiah weakens against US dollar amid trade tensions and Trump's tariff decision.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.17% against the US dollar on Thursday, reaching Rp 16,339 per dollar, amid concerns over President Donald Trump's decision to maintain a 20% tariff on China, which could trigger retaliation from Beijing. Meanwhile, the rupiah strengthened 0.34% to Rp 16,315 per dollar in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) market, as Trump is reportedly set to remove a 10% tariff on energy imports from Canada, including crude oil and gasoline.

title: PT Aneka Tambang's Performance to be Boosted by Rising Global Gold Prices
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) is expected to benefit from the increasing global gold price trend, which will positively impact its revenue, as gold sales contribute significantly to the company's income. The partnership with PT Freeport Indonesia is also projected to boost ANTM's business, according to Rizal Nur Rafly, an equity research analyst at Panin Sekuritas.

title: Directorate General of Taxation Faces Challenges in Meeting Tax Revenue Targets This Year Due to Economic Slowdown and Administrative Issues.
body: The Directorate General of Taxes, Ministry of Finance, is facing challenges in achieving its tax revenue target this year, with a significant decline in tax receipts in January 2025, particularly in regions such as Papua, West Papua, and Maluku, which saw a 41.27% year-on-year contraction to Rp 485.59 billion. The decline is attributed to various factors, including a slowing economy and administrative system issues with Coretax.

title: Indonesian Stock Index Continues to Rise with 1.32% Gain Despite Foreign Net Sell.
body: The Indonesian stock market continued its rally on Thursday, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rising 1.32% to 6,617.84, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 37.09 billion. Analysts have provided recommendations for several stocks, which can be accessed by subscribing to the article.

title: Prabowo Administration Opens Up Strategic Positions in Ministries and Agencies for 2024 Presidential Election Supporters
body: Maroef Sjamsoeddin, brother of Defense Minister Safrie Sjamsoeddin, a close associate of President Prabowo Subianto, has been appointed as the Director of Holding Pertambangan BUMN, MIND ID, a strategic position in the mining sector. This move is seen as an opportunity for President Prabowo's supporters to occupy key positions in various ministries and agencies ahead of the 2024 presidential election.

title: Government's 8% Economic Growth Ambition Faces Challenges Amid Civil Servant Recruitment Delay and Mass Layoffs.
body: The Indonesian government's goal of achieving 8% economic growth may be hindered by the delay in appointing new civil servants, which could have boosted purchasing power, amidst the threat of mass layoffs, including the recent large-scale layoffs at PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk (SIIC). The delay and layoffs may negatively impact the country's economic growth and purchasing power.

title: Indonesian Coal Miners Boost Production and Sales Despite Potential Profit Pressure
body: PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) aims to increase its coal production to 50 million tons and sales to 50.1 million tons this year, representing a 15.47% and 16.78% year-over-year growth, respectively. Despite this, the company's net profit is still expected to be pressured by several sentiments, highlighting the challenges faced by coal issuers in the current market.

title: Household Loan Default Rate Rises to 2.17% in January 2025
body: The non-performing loan (NPL) ratio for household credit in Indonesia increased to 2.17% in January 2025, with the highest NPL ratio coming from housing loans, according to Bank Indonesia. Banks such as CIMB Niaga, BCA (BBCA), and Bank Mandiri (BMRI) are taking a cautious approach to lending, with BCA increasing its provisioning by 205% to Rp 568 billion and Bank Mandiri seeing a 10% annual increase in consumer credit disbursement.

title: Indomobil Multi Jasa to Conduct Rights Issue to Raise Capital by Issuing Up to 3 Billion New Shares.
body: PT Indomobil Multi Jasa Tbk (IMJS) plans to conduct a rights issue, issuing up to 3 billion new shares with a nominal value of IDR 200 per share, aiming to raise capital. The move is expected to strengthen the company's financial position, a subsidiary of the Salim Group, which operates in the automotive sector.

title: Government's Flood Control Efforts in Jakarta Area Incomplete Due to Land Availability Issues
body: The Indonesian government has allocated IDR 1.1 trillion for the construction of the Bekasi River dam to mitigate flooding in the Jakarta area, but the project's progress has been hindered by land acquisition issues. The government's approach to addressing flooding and other issues, such as food price hikes, has been criticized for being superficial and not addressing the root causes of the problems.

title: Technology sector index surges 72.93% this year, driven by strong performance of stocks like DCII and GOTO.
body: The technology sector index has strengthened by 72.93% since the beginning of the year, with PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII) and PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) being the top contributors, with their shares rising by 233.67% and 17.14%, respectively, and contributing 129.88 and 26.37 points to the IHSG index. Analysts from Maybank Sekuritas, JP Morgan, Kiwoom Sekuritas, and Mirae Asset Sekuritas expect GOTO's shares to continue rising, with target prices ranging from Rp 89 to Rp 100 per share, driven by its improving profitability and growth.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Continues to Rise Amid Weakening US Dollar.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) continued its rally on Thursday, gaining 86.44 points or 1.32% to reach 6,617.84, driven by the weakening US dollar and positive sentiment from Donald Trump's tariff policy. According to Oktavianus Audi, VP Marketing and Strategy Planning at Kiwoom Sekuritas, the strengthening euro and dollar's decline are expected to have a positive impact on the IHSG.

title: Bank Raya Indonesia Expands Digital Credit Offerings with Five New Products Targeting Micro Segments
body: PT Bank Raya Indonesia Tbk (BRI) is aggressively promoting its digital credit products, targeting the micro segment with smaller and shorter-tenor loans, and now offers five digital credit products. The bank aims to maximize synergy within the BRI group, focusing on supply chain-based ecosystems and fintech partnerships to drive growth in its digital credit business.

title: Kreasi Jasa Persada Increases Stake in Petrosea by Buying 39.71 Million Shares
body: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, the controlling shareholder of PT Petrosea TBK (PTRO), increased its stake in the coal mining company by purchasing 39.71 million shares, with 16.77 million shares bought at IDR 2,982 per share on Tuesday. This move is part of a trend of controlling shareholders in various Indonesian companies increasing their stakes in their respective firms.

title: President Prabowo Subianto's newly released national budget efficiency policy receives appreciation and support from all parties.
body: The Indonesian government's new efficiency policy, led by President Prabowo Subianto, aims to address public concerns over inefficiencies in the state budget, which has been plagued by corruption and mismanagement, with some experts suggesting that the country could still function with a 30% reduction in the state budget. The policy is seen as a crucial step in addressing the moral hazard of government officials and potentially saving trillions of rupiah in the state budget.

title: Pertamina conducts surprise inspections to reaffirm fuel quality amid corruption allegations.
body: Pertamina (PERTM), Indonesia's state-owned energy company, has conducted surprise inspections at multiple fuel stations in Jakarta, confirming that its fuel products meet government-mandated quality standards, amid allegations of tampering and an ongoing corruption investigation. The company faces scrutiny over a massive corruption case involving illegal crude oil imports and fraudulent fuel blending, with estimated state losses of RP 193.7 trillion, making it one of Indonesia's largest corruption scandals.

title: Matahari Department Store's Profit Rises 22.5% Despite Slight Decline in Sales.
body: PT Matahari Department Store Tbk's profit grew 22.5% year-on-year to IDR 828 billion in 2024, driven by a gross margin of 34.6% and EBITDA of IDR 1.39 trillion, despite a 2% decline in total sales to IDR 12.3 trillion. The company's commitment to profitability and refining its products has enabled it to achieve sustainable growth, according to CEO Monish Mansukhani.

title: DCI Indonesia's shares reach all-time high with 239.82% increase in a month driven by planned stock split.
body: PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII) shares surged 9.98% to IDR 154,500 per share, marking an all-time high since its initial listing in 2021, with a 239.82% increase over the past month. The recent spike in share price is driven by news of a planned stock split, with the company's net profit increasing 21.34% to IDR 449.49 billion in September 2024.

title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Achieves Triple-Digit Growth in Revenue and Profit in 2024.
body: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk (CUAN) achieved outstanding results in 2024, with net profit attributable to owners reaching USD 160.8 million, a 929% year-on-year increase, and revenue soaring to USD 801.7 million, a 719% year-over-year growth. This performance marks the company's highest record in its history, allowing it to distribute dividends to shareholders in the 2024 fiscal year.

title: Bank Mandiri Records 19.5% Credit Growth in 2024, Surpassing National Industry Average
body: PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI) recorded a 19.5% year-on-year credit growth, reaching IDR 1,670.55 trillion in 2024, significantly surpassing the national banking industry's average growth rate of 10.39%. The bank's net credit grew IDR 225 trillion in 2024, with a loan-to-deposit ratio of 93% in January 2025, indicating healthy growth, and is targeting higher credit growth in 2025 despite challenges.

title: Debunking the Myth: Palm Oil Does Not Contain Cholesterol and May Even Help Lower Bad Cholesterol
body: The myth that palm oil consumption increases cholesterol levels has been debunked, as studies show that palm oil is "net neutral" and can even reduce bad cholesterol (LDL) by 21% and increase good cholesterol (HDL) by 24%. This revelation can benefit the palm oil industry, as consumers may no longer avoid products containing palm oil, potentially boosting sales and revenue for companies that use palm oil in their products.

title: New Oil Refinery Project with 500,000 Barrels per Day Capacity to be Built in Pemping Island, Riau Archipelago
body: The Indonesian government plans to build a new oil refinery with a capacity of 500,000 barrels per day on Pemping Island, Riau Islands, as announced by Deputy Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Yuliot Tanjung. The project will be located near Batam, and not on Nipa Island as previously rumored, which is instead slated to host a 1 million barrel per day oil storage facility.

title: Indonesian Sharia Banks to Expand Financing Despite Industry Challenges
body: Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BSI) targets a 14%-16% growth in financing this year, with a 15.88% annual credit growth in 2024, despite the banking industry facing challenges. Several banks are setting targets for double-digit financing growth, indicating a strong expansion in Islamic banking financing this year.

title: Knight Frank Indonesia Identifies Industrial and Logistics as High-Growth, Low-Risk Property Subsector
body: Knight Frank Indonesia notes that the industrial and logistics subsector has minimal risk and high growth potential, making it a preferred choice for investors in various cities across Asia Pacific, including Southeast Asia. The Greater Jakarta and Subang areas are seen as the most promising submarkets for industrial and logistics, driven by the auto-related sector, particularly electric vehicle production and its related industries.

title: Indonesian Ministry of Industry Issues Certificates for 20 Apple Products with High Local Content.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Industry has issued 20 domestic component level certificates for Apple (AAPL) products, comprising 11 certificates for mobile phone products and 9 certificates for tablet computer products. This certification is expected to have a positive impact on Apple's business in Indonesia, although specific financial metrics are not disclosed.

title: Indonesian Government Stands Firm on Coal Pricing Policy Despite Protests from Chinese Buyers
body: The Indonesian government remains unmoved by protests from Chinese coal buyers, sticking to its policy of using a benchmark price for coal exports, despite reports of rejection from Chinese importers. The Director-General of Mineral and Coal at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Tri Winarno, confirmed that the implementation of the benchmark price for coal exports will continue as scheduled.

title: PT Delta Giri Wacana Tbk Eyes Revenue and Profit Growth through Expansion of Fertilizer and Agrochemical Business.
body: PT Delta Dunia Makmur Tbk (DGWG) is optimistic about boosting revenue and profit growth from its fertilizer and agrochemical business, driven by the promising prospects of the agribusiness industry this year. Following its initial public offering on January 13, 2025, the company is taking expansion steps, capitalizing on the government's efforts to achieve food security and supporting the national agricultural sector.

title: Investment in Stocks by Pension Funds Continues to Decline in Recent Years
body: Investment in stocks by pension funds in Indonesia has been declining over the past few years, with the trend likely to continue given the current market conditions, as data from the Financial Services Authority shows that stock investments in all types of pension funds have decreased at least over the past five years. The allocation of funds to stocks by pension providers, for example, has fallen from IDR 20.7 trillion in December 2020 to IDR 15.9 trillion by the end of 2024.

title: Cinema XXI Prepares to Release Five New Local Films During Idul Fitri Holiday
body: PT Nusantara Sejahtera Raya Tbk (NUSANTARA), the operator of Cinema XXI, is preparing to release five new local films during the Idul Fitri holiday, expecting to capitalize on the long weekend. The films, including Jumbo, Komang, Norma, Pabrik Gula, and Qodrat 2, are expected to attract a large audience and generate significant revenue for the company.

title: Consumer Spending Slows Down One Week Before Ramadan in Indonesia
body: Consumer spending in Indonesia slowed down one week before Ramadan, as reflected in the spending index measured by PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI) and PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA). The decline in spending is a notable trend ahead of the holy month, which typically sees an increase in consumer expenditure.

title: Fintech Lending Industry Faces Dual Threat of Increased Loan Demand and Rising Default Rates During Ramadan and Lebaran.
body: During Ramadan and Lebaran, Indonesia's fintech lending industry is expected to see an increase in loan demand, but the fragile economic condition poses a threat of rising non-performing loans (NPLs), with the Financial Services Authority warning of a potential increase in NPLs above 90 days (TWP90). This caution comes after a rise in NPLs was seen during the same period last year.

title: Thousands of workers in various regions face layoffs, including 10,665 employees at a major textile factory in Surakarta, despite approaching Eid celebrations.
body: Sritex, a textile factory reportedly the largest in Southeast Asia, has filed for bankruptcy, resulting in the layoff of 10,665 workers. This recent case of mass layoffs, known as PHK, highlights the struggles faced by workers in various regions, particularly during the holiday season.

title: Vastland Indonesia Allocates Rp 3-4 Billion for Capital Expenditure in 2025
body: PT Vastland Indonesia Tbk (VAST) has allocated a capital expenditure of IDR 3 billion to IDR 4 billion for 2025, focusing on asset maintenance to support contract extensions. The company remains committed to expanding into strategic areas, aligning with its growth strategy, according to Director Stanley V. Gunawan.

title: 6.7 Million Annual Income Tax Notifications Reported to Directorate General of Taxation as of March 6, 2025.
body: As of March 6, 2025, 6.7 million annual tax returns for 2024 have been reported to the Directorate General of Taxes, Ministry of Finance, which is only 33.88% of the total required reports. This indicates a significant gap in tax compliance, with a large number of taxpayers still needing to submit their annual tax returns.

title: Indonesia's Democracy Rating Drops to 59th Globally Due to Erosion of Civil Liberties and Political Dynasties.
body: Indonesia's democracy score dropped to 6.44 from 6.53 last year, ranking 59th globally, according to the Economist Intelligence Unit's report, citing a decline in political culture and civil liberties. The country's flawed democracy label is attributed to the strengthening of political dynasties and the erosion of checks and balances, which may lead to further accountability and institutional weaknesses.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Meets with Top Entrepreneurs at the Presidential Palace to Discuss Investment Opportunities
body: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto met with prominent business leaders, including Garibaldi Thohir, Andi Syamsuddin Arsyad, and Anthony Salim, to discuss the Badan Pengelola Investasi (BPI) Daya Anagata Nusantara, a state-owned investment management firm. The meeting aimed to explore opportunities for investment and growth, with no specific financial metrics or outcomes disclosed.

title: Floods in Jakarta and surrounding areas cause estimated economic losses of over Rp 5 trillion.
body: The recent floods in Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Bekasi, and Tangerang have resulted in estimated economic losses of over Rp 5 trillion, according to Ketua Umum Kamar Dagang dan Industri DKI Jakarta Diana Dewi. The floods have had a direct impact on many sectors, including the economy, with total losses expected to reach trillions of rupiah.

title: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves decrease to $154.5 billion at the end of February 2025.
body: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves reached $154.5 billion at the end of February 2025, down from $156.1 billion at the end of January 2025, mainly due to government foreign debt payments and efforts to stabilize the rupiah exchange rate amidst high global financial market uncertainty. The decline in foreign exchange reserves was influenced by these factors, according to Executive Director of the Communication Department, Bi Ramdan Denny Prakoso.

title: Jasa Marga to Continue Asset Recycling Strategy in 2025 to Ease Financial Burden
body: PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) will continue its asset recycling strategy in 2025 to alleviate the company's financial burden, particularly after reporting a decline in net profit in 2024. The toll road operator is opening up opportunities for investors to take over ownership of its toll roads, aiming to improve its financial performance.

title: Indonesian Composite Stock Price Index Rises for Third Consecutive Day
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) continued its three-day rally, closing at 6,636.00 on Friday, up 18.15 points or 0.27% from the previous day's close, and has risen 5.83% in the first week of March 2025. The index's gain has boosted its performance throughout the week, with no specific company mentioned.

title: Cuan's Revenue and Net Profit Soar in 2024 with 718.58% and 929.32% Year-over-Year Growth Respectively
body: Cuan's revenue skyrocketed 718.58% year-over-year to $97.94 million in 2024, resulting in a net profit of $160.78 million, a 929.32% increase from $15.62 million in 2023. This significant growth translates to approximately IDR 2.61 trillion in 2024, marking a substantial improvement in the company's financial performance.

title: ABM Investama to Expand Gold Mining Operations as Part of Business Diversification
body: PT ABM Investama Tbk (ABMM) is planning to expand its gold mining business this year as part of its diversification strategy, according to Director Hans Christian Manoe. This move is expected to contribute to the company's growth and revenue, although specific financial metrics were not disclosed.

title: Nippon Indosari Corpindo Reports Strong Revenue and Profit Growth in 2024
body: PT Nippon Indosari Corpindo Tbk (NIPP) reported a remarkable performance in 2024, with a net profit of IDR 362.56 billion, an 8.78% increase from IDR 333.29 billion in 2023. The company's revenue also saw significant growth, driven by its strong performance in the year.

title: Sido Muncul Records Impressive Performance in 2024 with Net Profit of Rp 1.17 Trillion, Up 23.18% Year-on-Year.
body: PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) reported impressive performance in 2024, with a net profit of IDR 1.17 trillion, up 23.18% year-over-year from IDR 950.64 billion in 2023. This significant increase in net profit highlights the company's strong financial performance in 2024.

title: Yupi Indo Jelly Gum's IPO to Provide Exit Strategy for Controlling Shareholders
body: PT Yupi Indo Jelly Gum Tbk is set to launch an initial public offering (IPO) as an exit strategy for its controllers, following a divestment of all shares after the IPO, with pre-IPO shareholders expected to reap significant profits. The company is offering up to 854.44 million shares, or 10% of its post-IPO capital, through a bookbuilding process from March 6 to 10, 2025.

title: Household Loan Repayment Ability Decreases, Non-Performing Loan Ratio Rises to 2.17%
body: According to Bank Indonesia's data, the non-performing loan (NPL) ratio for household credit reached 2.17% in January 2025, up from 1.9% in January 2024 and 2.02% in December 2024, indicating a decline in households' ability to pay installments. This increase in NPL ratio suggests a growing concern about household debt sustainability.

title: Government Targets 13.27% Increase in Tax Revenue to IDR 2.189 Trillion in 2025 APBN
body: The Indonesian government has set a target of IDR 2.189 trillion in tax revenue for 2025, representing a 13.27% growth from the previous year, driven by optimism in improved tax compliance, better economic growth, and supportive fiscal policies. This growth rate is significantly higher than the 8.8% and 3.46% growth achieved in 2023 and 2024, respectively.

title: PT Rukun Raharja Sells 4.66% Stake in PT Raharja Energi Cepu.
body: PT Rukun Raharja Tbk (RAJA) surprisingly sold a small portion of its shares in PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk (RATU), amounting to 126.52 million shares or 4.66% of the company's fully paid and placed capital. Despite the sale, RAJA remains the majority shareholder with a 75.34% stake in RATU, ensuring no change in control.

title: Two major footwear factories in Tangerang, Indonesia, supplying global brands like Nike and Adidas, lay off thousands of workers amid declining orders.
body: Two major footwear factories in Tangerang, Indonesia, supplying global sportswear brands like Nike (NKE) and Adidas (ADS), have laid off thousands of workers due to sharply declining orders, with Victory Chingluh cutting around 2,000 jobs and Adis Dimension Footwear eliminating 1,500 jobs. In response, the Indonesian government has announced a Rp 20 trillion credit facility to help labor-intensive industries, including textiles, garments, and footwear, stay afloat.

title: Bank Permata's corporate loan disbursement increases 11.7% year-on-year in January 2025, driven by strong traction in key industry sectors.
body: PT Bank Permata Tbk (BNLI) reported an 11.7% year-on-year increase in corporate loan disbursement until the end of January 2025, with total loan distribution reaching IDR 152.69 trillion, driven by strong traction in corporate and commercial loans. The bank's gross non-performing loan ratio also improved, dropping from 2.9% in 2023 to 2.1% in 2024, with the corporate segment performing better than other segments.

title: Michelin Completes Tender Offer for PT Multistrada Arah Sarana Shares
body: Compagnie Générale des Établissements Michelin (CGEM) acquired 29.10 million shares of PT Multistrada Arah Sarana Tbk at IDR 8,400 per share through a tender offer, increasing its total shareholding to 9.17 billion shares from 8.14 billion shares. As a result, CGEM now holds 99.64% of the company's outstanding shares, with around 4.07 million public shares remaining, as part of its plan to change the company's status from a listed public company to a privately held company.

title: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi diversifies revenue sources in 2024, reducing dependence on coal sales.
body: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk (CUAN) successfully diversified its revenue sources in 2024, with coal sales accounting for 34%, mining services and EPC contractors each contributing 31%, and other services making up 4%. The company's revenue composition shifted from 100% thermal coal in 2023 to 54% thermal coal, 26% gold copper, 10% metallurgical coal, and 9% oil gas in 2024, marking a significant milestone towards becoming an integrated energy and mineral mining company.

title: Indonesia Launches First Bullion Bank, Aims to Revolutionize National Gold Resource Management
body: On February 26, 2025, President Prabowo Subianto inaugurated Indonesia's first bullion bank, marking a significant step in managing and utilizing the country's national gold resources. The Financial Services Authority has issued a business license to Bank Syariah Indonesia (BSI) and Pegadaian to operate the bullion bank, expected to be a game changer for Indonesia's financial sector.

title: Indonesian Stock Market to Introduce New Derivative Instrument, Put Warrant, to Boost Investment Opportunities
body: The Indonesian stock market is set to welcome a new derivative instrument, put warrants, with two series to be listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on Monday, providing a breath of fresh air in the current bearish market conditions. Put warrants, a type of structured warrant, allow investors to invest in stocks with lower capital, using leverage, which is a smaller ratio compared to the underlying stock price.

title: Alam Tri Bangun Indonesia to Acquire PT Kalimantan Industrial Park Indonesia through Share Issuance and Debt Conversion.
body: PT Alam Tri Bangun Indonesia, a subsidiary of Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk (ALTO), plans to acquire PT Kalimantan Industrial Park Indonesia through a share issuance mechanism, where Alam Tri Bangun Indonesia will redeem the shares by converting debt into equity. The acquisition is expected to strengthen Alam Tri Bangun Indonesia's position in the industry, with financial metrics likely to be impacted by the deal.

title: PT Nirvana Wastu Pratama receives $53 million sustainability-linked loan from International Finance Corporation and OCBC Nisp to expand green certification in its property projects.
body: PT Nirvana Wastu Pratama (no ticker) received a $53 million sustainability-linked loan from International Finance Corporation and PT OCBC Nisp to expand its green certification in property projects, marking a historic moment for Indonesia's property industry. The loan is part of the company's agenda to reduce carbon emissions from its business operations.

title: Government Targets Launch of 70,000 Red-White Village Cooperatives by July 12, 2025
body: The Indonesian government targets to launch 70,000 Red-White Village Cooperatives (Kopdes Merah Putih) on July 12, 2025, coinciding with National Cooperative Day, to increase community productivity, welfare, and village prosperity. The government will provide outlets for the cooperatives to systematically absorb village products, including agricultural and livestock products, to improve the economy.

title: Bank Rakyat Indonesia's Stock Price Rises 13.39% in a Week
body: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) shares have been on an upward trend over the past week, closing at IDR 3,810 per share on Friday, a 13.39% increase from the previous week. This significant surge in share price indicates a positive outlook for the bank's financial performance.

title: KPK Investigates Alleged Budget Cut in Free Nutritious Meal Program
body: The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) is investigating alleged irregularities in the allocation of funds for the Free Nutritious Food (MBG) program, where the budget was supposedly cut from Rp 10,000 to Rp 8,000 per serving. This reduction in funding has raised concerns about the quality of food provided, according to KPK Chairman Setyo Budianto.

title: Pertamina Hulu Energi Reports Increased Oil and Gas Production in January 2025
body: PT Pertamina Hulu Energi (PHE) reported a daily oil production of 553,670 barrels and 2.826 million cubic meters of gas in January 2025, with the company completing two exploration wells, 70 exploitation wells, 80 workovers, and 3,016 well services. To optimize oil and gas production, PHE is implementing various strategies, including exploring new areas, reactivating non-producing wells, and applying enhanced oil recovery technologies such as waterflood and steamflood to increase efficiency.

title: Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources to Conduct Regular Evaluations of PT Freeport Indonesia's Smelter Development Every Three Months.
body: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will conduct regular evaluations every three months on the progress of PT Freeport Indonesia's smelter development after granting a six-month copper concentrate export permit. The evaluations aim to ensure the improvement of the Manyar smelter, which was previously damaged by a fire, and will be carried out in accordance with the Minister's regulations.

title: PetroChina International Jabung Urges Government to Address Drilling Equipment Shortage in Oil and Gas Industry
body: PetroChina International Jabung is facing challenges in drilling new wells and maintaining old ones due to a shortage of drilling equipment and services, which is impacting the upstream oil and gas industry. The company has prepared a massive drilling plan for 2025, following the extension of its Jabung block concession, but is seeking government assistance to address the equipment and service shortage.

title: Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources Releases Regulation on Green Energy-Based Electricity Trading
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has released Regulation No. 5/2025, providing guidelines for the sale and purchase of electricity from renewable energy sources, aiming to promote energy independence and accelerate renewable energy development. The regulation outlines key points, including contract duration, project implementation guarantees, refinancing with financiers, and the use of local components, to support the growth of Indonesia's renewable energy sector.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Sees Highest Growth in ASEAN Region in Early March 2025
body: The Indonesian stock market index performed the best in the region in the first week of March 2025, with the country's stock index experiencing the highest growth among several major ASEAN nations. This strong performance is a significant outcome for Indonesia's economy and investment landscape.

title: Indonesian Life Insurance Industry Growth Slows Down in 2024 Despite 12.5% Increase in Premium Revenue.
body: Asosiasi Asuransi Jiwa Indonesia reported that the revenue of group life insurance premiums in 2024 grew by 12.5% to IDR 32.96 trillion, but the growth rate slowed down from 16.5% in 2023. The industry's performance is showing a slowing trend due to increasing burdens, causing companies to be more selective in providing insurance benefits to their employees.

title: Rupiah expected to continue strengthening, albeit limited, amid US dollar weakness and uncertainty over Trump's tariff policy.
body: The Indonesian rupiah is expected to continue its strengthening trend, albeit limited, driven by the weakening US dollar and uncertainty surrounding President Donald Trump's tariff policies, with the spot rupiah appreciating 0.28% to Rp 16,295 per dollar on Friday. Meanwhile, the rupiah Jisdor rate at Bank Indonesia weakened 0.12% to Rp 16,336 per dollar.

title: Summarecon Agung Clarifies Director's Involvement in Muhammad Haniv's Corruption Case
body: PT Summarecon Agung Tbk (SMRA) clarified that one of its subsidiary's directors was summoned by the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) in relation to the corruption case of former tax official Muhammad Haniv, who allegedly received gratification worth Rp 21.5 billion. The company's statement comes amid the ongoing investigation into the corruption case, which has implicated several high-ranking officials.

title: Indonesian General Insurance Industry Expects Single-Digit Premium Growth in 2025 Amid Challenges
body: The Indonesian general insurance industry is expected to experience a challenging year in 2025, with premium growth predicted to only increase by a single digit due to various obstacles. Initially, the Indonesian General Insurance Association had forecast a double-digit growth in premium revenue for this year, but this projection is now deemed difficult to achieve given the current conditions.

title: Poultry Sector Prospects Remain Positive in 2025 Amid Ramadan Momentum and Free Nutritious Food Program.
body: The poultry sector is expected to remain positive in 2025, driven by the Ramadan momentum and the free nutritious food program, which will boost chicken prices. According to Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia analyst Abdul Azis Setyo Wibowo, the sector's prospects are positive due to the price increase during Ramadan.

title: Government Offers Attractive Returns on Sukuk Tabungan ST014 Investment Product
body: The Indonesian government has launched Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014, a retail investment product offering attractive coupons and a higher level of security, with yields of 6.5% per annum for a 2-year tenor and 6.6% per annum for a 4-year tenor. This investment product provides individual investors with a new option for their portfolios, offering a relatively high return with lower risk.

title: Matahari Department Store Prepares Strategies to Boost Business Amid Slowing Consumer Spending.
body: PT Matahari Department Store Tbk (MATA) is preparing strategies to tackle business challenges in 2025, including expanding its exclusive brand collection to attract young and modern consumers. The company will focus on the growth of its Suko brand and continue to penetrate the fashion-conscious segment with its Zes brand, launched in Q4-2024.

title: Indonesia Allocates IDR 308 Trillion for 21 Downstream Projects, Raising Questions on Commitment to Green Economy and Global Decarbonization Trend.
body: The Indonesian government has allocated IDR 308 trillion for 21 projects, including oil refineries and coal gasification, sparking concerns about the country's commitment to green economy and decarbonization. Despite the global trend of renewable energy growth, with a 54% increase in capacity by 2024, the projects may become stranded assets, with European coal demand decreasing by 15% and the global renewable energy market reaching USD 1.3 trillion.

title: Indonesian Economy Faces Multiple Challenges Despite IHSG Gains
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) rose 0.27% to 6,636, driven by sentiment from President Prabowo Subianto's meeting with conglomerates, despite foreign investors recording a net sale of IDR 20.91 trillion since the start of 2025. Meanwhile, the rupiah strengthened to IDR 15,336 per dollar, and foreign exchange reserves reached USD 154.5 billion in February 2025, but economic indicators such as middle-class savings and fintech lending growth remain concerning.

title: Bank Indonesia Calls for Extra Efforts to Achieve 8% Economic Growth Target
body: To achieve an 8% economic growth target, Bank Indonesia (BI) emphasizes the need to triple the contribution of total factor productivity (TFP) to Indonesia's gross domestic product (GDP) to 3.61% by 2025-2029, as the current TFP contribution is only 1.37%. The country's low investment efficiency, reflected in its high incremental capital output ratio (ICOR) of 6.33 in 2023, and low foreign investment, with a capital-to-GDP ratio of less than 20%, also need to be addressed to support economic growth.

title: Elnusa Targets 5% Revenue and 15% Net Profit Growth in 2025
body: PT Elnusa Tbk (ELNUSA) projects a 5% increase in revenue and a 15% increase in net profit in 2025, driven by selective and prudent investment principles focusing on profitability growth. The company, a subsidiary of Pertamina, aims to continue its performance growth this year through various business strategies.

title: Government Debt Ratio Predicted to Exceed 40% of GDP by 2025
body: Indonesia's government debt ratio is predicted to exceed 40% of its gross domestic product (GDP) by 2025, surpassing the target of 39.15% set in the National Medium-Term Development Plan 2025-2029, with total government debt reaching IDR 8.909 trillion as of January 31, 2025. The high debt ratio could lead to crowding out, reduce domestic liquidity, and hinder economic growth, emphasizing the need for the government to optimize its budget, diversify funding sources, and maintain low inflation.

title: Jakarta Composite Stock Price Index Expected to Strengthen This Week Amid Anticipated Release of Economic Data
body: The Jakarta Composite Index is expected to strengthen at the beginning of the week, driven by anticipated economic data releases from within and outside the country. Investors will closely monitor the release of the US inflation data for February 2025, which is expected to decline to 2.9% year-over-year from 3% in January 2025.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Meets with American Investor Ray Dalio and Indonesian Conglomerates to Discuss Economy.
body: President Prabowo Subianto met with prominent US investor Ray Dalio and several Indonesian conglomerates, including Anthony Salim, Sugianto Kusuma, and Chairul Tanjung, to discuss the economy and boost public confidence. The meetings, which took place several times, aim to address public pessimism about Indonesia's economy and potentially attract foreign investment.

title: Government Plans to Merge Seven State-Owned Construction Companies into One Holding Company
body: The Indonesian government plans to merge seven state-owned construction companies into a single holding company, a change from the initial plan to create three holdings, amid uncertainty in the domestic construction industry. This new plan was discussed during a hearing at the Indonesian House of Representatives, marking a significant development in the restructuring of the state-owned construction sector.

title: Several listed companies, mostly from energy and mining sectors, release 2025 capital expenditure guidance.
body: Several listed companies, mainly from the energy and mining sectors, have released their 2025 guidance, including capital expenditure plans, with Adaro Group's PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk (ALTO) allocating around $475 million to $525 million for capex. The guidance provides insight into the companies' future financial performance and investment plans.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Strengthens in Early March After Regulatory Signals and Presidential Meeting with Investors
body: The Indonesian stock market, which faced significant pressure in February, has started to recover in the first week of March, with the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) strengthening after the authorities signaled the implementation of market stabilization policies. The IHSG's recovery was also boosted by a meeting between President Prabowo Subianto and Indonesian business leaders, including Raymond Thomas Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates (no ticker symbol).

title: Government Partners with 19 Banks to Distribute Sharia Retail Investment Instruments Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014
body: The Indonesian government has partnered with 19 banks to distribute Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014, a Sharia-compliant retail investment instrument, offering two tenors: a 2-year tenor with a 6.5% return and a 4-year tenor with a 6.6% return. The instrument has been available for purchase since March 7 and will be available until March 16, 2025.

title: PT Lautan Luas Tbk's Revenue Increases 5.6% to Rp 7.72 Trillion in 2024.
body: PT Lautan Luas Tbk (LTLS) reported a revenue of Rp 7.72 trillion in 2024, a 5.6% increase from Rp 7.31 trillion in 2023. The company's net profit also surged 36.92% to Rp 220.36 billion in 2024, up from Rp 160.94 billion in the previous year.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Meets with US Investor Ray Dalio to Discuss Indonesia's Sovereign Wealth Fund
body: President Prabowo Subianto met with US investor Ray Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates (managing $89.6 billion assets), to discuss Indonesia's newly launched sovereign wealth fund, Lippo Group, and explore ways to drive economic growth. Dalio shared his expertise on investment strategies, corporate governance, and risk management, and President Prabowo expressed enthusiasm for Dalio's insights, seeking to strengthen Indonesia's investment strategy and ensure progress in the global economy.

title: Government Targets Rp 55.4 Trillion in Credit Distribution for Small Businesses by Q1 2025
body: The Indonesian government targets to disburse Rp 55.4 trillion in People's Business Credit (KUR) by the end of Q1-2025, with a total quota of Rp 300 trillion set for this year, of which Rp 28.73 trillion has been realized as of February 21. The government's efforts to boost KUR disbursement aim to support national economic growth.

title: Used Car Sales in Indonesia See Significant Increase Ahead of Lebaran 2025
body: Ahead of Lebaran 2025, the used car sales trend is showing a significant increase, particularly on auction platforms like Aucsi, a subsidiary of PT Mitra Pinasthika Mustika Tbk (MPMX), with sales growing 20% since January. This surge indicates high consumer interest in finding vehicles for Lebaran and business purposes.

title: Irish carrier BBN Airlines ceases passenger flights in Indonesia, shifts focus to aircraft leasing.
body: BBN Airlines (no ticker) has ceased passenger flight operations in Indonesia and shifted its business model to aircraft leasing, with Sriwijaya Air as its first customer, amid a constrained global aircraft supply chain. The company's strategic pivot is driven by limited aircraft availability, which creates an opportunity for leasing businesses, and it aims to provide flexible fleet solutions to airlines in the region, supporting the aviation sector with reliable leasing solutions.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Slumps to Lowest Level Since 2021 Amid Market Volatility
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) slumped 7.36% from the beginning of 2025, reaching its lowest level since October 2021, resulting in a IDR886 trillion (7.18%) loss in market capitalization, which now stands at IDR11,450 trillion. Despite a 5.8% gain during 3-7 March 2025, analysts believe the market is still challenging, and foreign investors, who have recorded an outflow of IDR22.35 trillion since the beginning of the year, will determine the trend of the JCI going forward.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Announces Cash Holiday Bonus for Online Transportation Drivers
body: President Prabowo Subianto announced that online transportation service providers, including Gojek (GOTO) and Grab, will provide cash holiday bonuses to their drivers, recognizing their significant contributions to Indonesia's transportation logistics services. The government will announce the bonus amount mechanism through a circular letter, benefiting approximately 250,000 active online drivers and 1-1.5 million part-time workers.

title: PT Adiwarna Anugerah Abadi's Net Profit Surges 134% in 2024 with Significant Revenue and Asset Growth.
body: PT Adiwarna Anugerah Abadi Tbk (NAIK) reported a 134% year-over-year increase in net profit to IDR 30.9 billion in 2024, driven by a 66% revenue growth to IDR 207.17 billion, with operating profit also rising 86% to IDR 41.65 billion. Since its IPO in November 2024, NAIK's market capitalization has reached IDR 347.75 billion, with its share price surging 418.7% to IDR 555 per share, although it corrected 16.54% in today's trading.

title: Indonesia's 2024 Palm Oil Production and Exports Decrease, Consumption Rises
body: Indonesia's total production of CPO and PKO in 2024 reached 52,762 thousand tons, a 3.80% decrease from 2023, with total consumption increasing by 2.78% to 23,859 thousand tons, driven by higher demand for biodiesel. The country's export value declined by 8.44% to US $27.76 billion in 2024, with a projected decrease in exports to 27.5 million tons in 2025, lower than the 29.5 million tons exported in 2024.
