body: The Indonesian government targets to complete the construction of a $1 billion - $1.2 billion methanol plant in Bojonegoro, East Java by the end of 2027, which is expected to support the mandatory biodiesel program. The program aims to launch B50, a biodiesel blend of 50% solar and 50% vegetable oil from palm oil, in 2026.

title: Minister Erick Thohir says State-Owned Enterprises Law allows companies to quickly change business models.
body: Indonesian Minister of State-Owned Enterprises Erick Thohir stated that the new law No. 1/2025 allows state-owned companies to quickly change their business models, citing PT Agrinas Palma Nusantara as an example, which has been granted the right to manage seized palm oil land from the Attorney General's Office, particularly from the corruption case of PT Duta Palma. This new law provides state-owned companies with the flexibility to adapt to changing business environments and opportunities.

title: Truck Entrepreneurs Announce Early Suspension of Goods Transportation Operations Starting March 20, 2025
body: Truck entrepreneurs announced a halt in cargo transportation operations starting March 20, 2025, four days earlier than the joint decree's regulation, which restricts cargo transportation from March 24 to April 8, 2025, resulting in a total of 20 days of logistics distribution disruption. This move is a protest against the 16-day operational ban, with significant implications for the logistics and transportation industry.

title: ATM transactions in Indonesia continue to decline as digital banking services grow.
body: According to Bank Indonesia's data, the number of ATM and debit transactions in 2024 reached 6.95 billion, a decline of 8.57% year-over-year, with the transaction value decreasing by 7.8% year-over-year to IDR 7.196.7 trillion. This downward trend is expected to continue as digitalization of banking services gains momentum.

title: Trump's Trade War Escalation Impacts Global Economy, Including Indonesia
body: The ongoing trade war triggered by President Donald Trump's executive order has led to a decline in Indonesia's financial metrics, with the rupiah exchange rate falling to Rp 16,309 per US dollar in February, and the yield on 10-year government bonds increasing to 6.98%. Meanwhile, tax revenue has decreased by 9.42% to Rp 298.87 trillion in February 2025, compared to the same period last year, due to declining commodity prices and layoffs.

title: Rupiah Under Pressure Against US Dollar Amid Weak Domestic Economic Data and Rising Trade Tension.
body: The Indonesian rupiah is under pressure against the US dollar this week, weighed down by weak domestic economic data and escalating trade tensions. Analysts attribute the decline to poor domestic sentiment, citing weakening economic indicators such as deflation and sluggish retail sales, which reflect low consumer purchasing power.

title: Gold price surges to record high of over US$3,000 per ounce amid global economic uncertainty and central banks' buying spree.
body: Gold spot prices surged to a record high of $3,007.5 per troy ounce, up 3.2% in a week, driven by massive buying from central banks, global economic uncertainty, and US President Donald Trump's efforts to restructure global trade with tariffs on allies and strategic competitors.

title: Avia Avian Expands Business Portfolio with 16.67% Stake Acquisition in Adhesive Industry Company Dextone Lemindo.
body: PT Avia Avian TBK (AVIA) expanded its business portfolio by acquiring a 16.67% stake in PT Dextone Lemindo, a company in the adhesive industry, for Rp 275.85 billion on March 13, 2025. This strategic move marks a significant investment for Avia, owned by taipan Hermanto Tanoko, as it diversifies its business interests.

title: PT Sinar Terang Mandiri Prepares for Expansion Amid Positive Outlook for Nickel Industry
body: PT Sinar Terang Mandiri Tbk (MINE) is optimistic about the nickel industry's prospects and plans to accelerate its expansion, particularly after raising funds from its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on March 10, 2025. The company, which provides nickel mining support services, expects to benefit from the growing demand for electric vehicles, which require nickel as a raw material.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 1.81% This Week Due to Foreign Selling Pressure
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) fell 1.98% on Friday and 1.81% over the week, closing in the red zone, with foreign transaction pressure reaching IDR 36.9 trillion. According to Oktavianus Audi, VP Marketing and Strategy Planning at Kiwoom Sekuritas, this decline was driven by foreign transaction pressure.

title: Market transactions slow down ahead of long Lebaran and Idul Fitri holidays.
body: As the long Lebaran and Idul Fitri holiday approaches, market players are reducing transactions, with daily transaction values trending downward to around IDR 9 trillion per day, allowing investors to consider short-term trading. The stock exchange will be closed from March 31 to April 7, 2025, with only 19 trading days in March 2024 and 16 trading days in April 2025.

title: QRIS Payment Method Gains Popularity in Indonesia Due to Convenience and Widespread Merchant Acceptance
body: QRIS payment method is gaining popularity in Indonesia, with transactions increasing rapidly due to its convenience and widespread adoption by merchants, especially small and medium-sized enterprises (UMKM). The ease of use, without the need to carry cash or cards, has made QRIS a preferred payment method for many, driving its growth in the country.

title: Tripar Multivision Plus expands market reach with grand opening of Platinum Cineplex Eastvara in BSD, Tangerang.
body: PT Tripar Multivision Plus Tbk (TRIP) has expanded its market reach by opening the Platinum Cineplex Eastvara in BSD, Tangerang, Banten, marking a strategic step to strengthen its ecosystem in the entertainment business, which includes film production, distribution, and exhibition. This move is expected to have a positive impact on the company's financial metrics, further solidifying its position in the industry.

title: Bank Indonesia expands QRIS usage as national standard for digital financial transactions in Indonesia.
body: Bank Indonesia continues to expand the use of QRIS, the national standard for digital financial transactions in Indonesia, through campaigns and innovation, introducing new features such as QRIS Tap, a near-field communication-based payment method. The latest innovation was developed in collaboration with the Indonesian Payment System Association, further enhancing the country's digital payment ecosystem.

title: Financial Services Authority Introduces Bullion Insurance Products in Indonesia
body: The Indonesian financial services authority, OJK, has introduced a new insurance product, Bullion, which provides protection for gold and precious metal storage and transportation, with premiums totaling Rp 15.62 trillion as of January. PT Asuransi Jasa Indonesia (JASINDO) and PT Asuransi Cakrawala Proteksi Indonesia (ACPI) have expressed interest in the product, seeing it as an opportunity to develop innovative products and expand their market, with Jasindo's gold safe and gold transit products experiencing a 40% decline in performance as of February 2025.

title: Blue Bird Ensures Optimal Transportation Services Ahead of Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr.
body: PT Blue Bird Tbk (BIRD) ensures its transportation business services remain optimal ahead of Ramadan and Idul Fitri 1446 Hijriah, offering flexible services to meet the mobility needs of the community during this period. The company is committed to providing reliable services to support the increased demand for transportation during the holiday season.

title: Indonesian Property Industry Expected to Surpass Economic Growth Projections This Year
body: Indonesia's property industry is projected to outperform economic growth expectations this year, driven by business and stock growth of companies like PT Ciputra Development Tbk (CTRA), PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk (PWON), and PT Bumi Serpong Damai Tbk (BSDE), with potential growth continuing despite economic challenges. The government's extension of the value-added tax incentive is expected to support marketing sales, with a predicted 4% increase in pre-sales of properties this year.

title: US-China Trade War to Boost Indonesia's Industrial Sector through Factory Relocations
body: The ongoing US-China trade war is expected to drive factory relocations from China to ASEAN, benefiting Indonesia, as seen in 2018-2019 when land sales in Indonesian industrial areas increased, driven mainly by non-Chinese buyers. This trend is expected to continue, with potential business opportunities arising, although capturing them may not be straightforward.

title: Foreign Investors Record Net Sell of 475.03 Million Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Foreign investors on the Indonesia Stock Exchange recorded a net sell of 475.03 million shares, with top sells including PT Petrosea TBK (PTRO) with 100 million shares, PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia TBK (GOTO) with 96.69 million shares, and PT Bank Central Asia TBK (BBCA) with 57 million shares. On the other hand, top buys included PT Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur TBK with 39.73 million shares, PT Maharaksa Biru Energi TBK with 26 million shares, and PT Bumi Resources TBK (BUMI) with 19 million shares.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Sees Significant Changes in Share Ownership with Multiple Investors Buying and Selling Stakes in Various Companies
body: Foreign investors, including Bes Trust Pte Ltd and Tugboat Barge Company, acquired significant stakes in Indonesian companies, such as PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk (7.54%) and PT Techno9 Indonesia Tbk (5.07%), through various securities firms. Meanwhile, several investors, including PT Trimegah Sekuritas Indonesia Tbk and PT Goldfive Investment Capital, sold significant shares in companies like PT Energi Mega Persada Tbk (16.37%) and PT Bintang Samudera Mandiri Lines Tbk (45.3%).

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Seeks Clarification on PT Perdana Bangun Pusaka's Volatile Stock Price
body: PT Perdana Bangun Pusaka Tbk (KONI) saw its stock price fluctuate and drop 1.52% to IDR 1,300 on Friday, with a 4.06% decline over the past week and a 19.50% drop over the past month. The company's corporate secretary stated that they are unaware of any material information that could affect the stock value and have no planned corporate actions that would impact listing shares in the capital market.

title: Lippo Group reduces stake in Lippo General Insurance through share sale, Hanwha Life Insurance becomes controlling shareholder.
body: Lippo Group's PT Inti Anugerah Pratama (IAP) sold 147 million shares of PT Lippo General Insurance Tbk (LPGI) at IDR 654 per share, raising IDR 96.13 billion in proceeds, decreasing its shareholding to 543 million shares. Meanwhile, Hanwha Life Insurance Indonesia transferred 1.39 billion LPGI shares to its parent company, Hanwha General Insurance Co. Ltd, increasing its shareholding to 61.5% and making it the controlling shareholder.

title: Jakarta Central District Court Rejects Harmas' Petition to Suspend Debt Payment Obligations Against Bukalapak.
body: The Jakarta Central District Commercial Court rejected Harmas' petition to suspend debt payment obligations against PT Bukalapak.com Tbk (BUKA), citing failure to meet basic evidence requirements and lack of creditor support. Despite the ruling, Bukalapak.com's shares fell 0.76% to IDR 130, with a trading volume of 200.01 million shares valued at IDR 26.27 billion.

title: Mirae Asset Sekuritas and Samuel Sekuritas Recommend Buying PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana with Target Prices of Rp 2,540 and Rp 2,500 per Share
body: PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana Tbk (SSMS) has seen its stock price surge 19.23% to IDR 1,550 since the beginning of 2025, with Mirae Asset Sekuritas Indonesia and Samuel Sekuritas recommending a "buy" with target prices of IDR 2,540 and IDR 2,500, respectively. The stock had previously been stuck around IDR 1,000 per share in 2024, but has recently broken out to reach as high as IDR 2,200 in early February 2025.

title: Government Regulates Bonus Payment for Online Transportation and Courier Drivers in 2025
body: The Indonesian government has officially regulated the provision of holiday bonuses for online transportation drivers and couriers in 2025, requiring transportation app companies to provide a 20% bonus of the average monthly income of their driver partners. This regulation aims to benefit online motorcycle taxi, online courier, and online taxi drivers, ensuring they receive a fair bonus for their work.

title: Around 146 million people, or 52% of Indonesia's population, are expected to travel back to their hometowns during the Eid al-Fitr holiday season.
body: According to a survey by the Transportation Policy Agency, Ministry of Transportation, an estimated 146.48 million people, equivalent to 52% of Indonesia's total population, are expected to participate in the mudik tradition this year. This significant number is likely to have a substantial impact on the economy, particularly in the transportation and tourism sectors.

title: Indonesia's Economy Worsens with Deficit and Decreased Tax Revenue
body: Indonesia's state budget (APBN) has recorded a deficit of IDR 31.2 trillion in the first two months of 2025, with tax revenue decreasing by 30.19% to IDR 187.8 trillion and total state revenue decreasing by 20.84% to IDR 316.9 trillion compared to the same period in 2024. Meanwhile, the country's middle to lower-class citizens are struggling, with a 2.6% monthly decline in savings below IDR 100 million and a surge in layoffs, leading to decreased purchasing power and a 0.09% annual deflation rate in February 2025.

title: Indonesian Moviegoers' Plastic Waste Problem: 8 Million Plastic Cups Thrown Away Annually
body: In 2024, Indonesia's cinema industry is projected to attract 80 million viewers, with at least 8 million plastic cups potentially being discarded as waste, assuming 10% of viewers consume drinks from plastic cups. This highlights the significant environmental impact of the industry, with potential economic implications for companies involved in the supply chain.

title: Realization of Free Nutritious Food Program Budget Reaches Rp 710.5 Billion as of March 12, 2025.
body: The realization of the free nutritious meal program budget has reached Rp 710.5 billion as of March 12, 2025, despite an allocation of Rp 171 trillion for the program this year. The low absorption of the budget is due to administrative adjustments, according to Dadan Hindayana, Head of the National Nutrition Agency.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Aims to Increase Research Funding to 1% of GDP to Support National Independence
body: President Prabowo Subianto aims to increase research funding in Indonesia to 1% of the country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) to support the government's efforts towards independence in various sectors. The Ministry of Education, Science, and Technology expects universities to produce high-quality human resources, conduct research, and innovate, ultimately leading to the development of superior products that will enable Indonesia's independence.

title: US Shifts Away from Multilateralism, Causing Tensions at G20 Meetings
body: The recent G20 finance ministers' meeting in South Africa ended without a communique or consensus, highlighting the US's shift towards unilateralism, with the country refusing to accept conclusions on multilateralism, climate finance, and global taxation. Indonesia, which held the G20 presidency in 2022, is now bracing itself for possible US tariffs, with a trade deficit of $19.3 billion in 2024, making it the US's 15th-largest deficit contributor that year.

title: Indonesia's state budget records deficit of Rp 31.2 trillion, or 0.13 percent of GDP, in February 2025.
body: Indonesia's state budget recorded a deficit of Rp 31.2 trillion, or 0.13% of the nation's GDP, as of February 28, 2025, with state revenue declining 20.85% year-on-year to Rp 316.9 trillion and government spending reaching Rp 348.1 trillion. Despite fiscal challenges, the government has financed 35.7% of the 2025 budget deficit and remains confident in its fiscal policies, which have contributed to a decline in administered price inflation from 7.38% in January to 2.65% in February.

title: Indonesian government forms special team to identify and revise regulations hindering investment growth.
body: The Indonesian government has established a special team to identify and evaluate regulations hindering investment growth, aiming to improve the country's economic climate and achieve an 8% economic growth target, with foreign direct investments accounting for 52.5% of the total Rp 1,714.2 trillion investment attracted last year. Singapore, Hong Kong, China, Malaysia, and the United States were the top foreign investors, contributing $20.1 billion, $8.2 billion, $8.1 billion, $4.2 billion, and $3.7 billion, respectively, to Indonesia's investment inflows in 2024.

title: Bank Central Asia, GoTo, and other stocks weigh down Indonesian Composite Index.
body: PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) and PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) were among the top laggards, with BBCA's share price falling 0.56% and GOTO's plummeting 5.81%, contributing to a 1.81% decline in the Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) to 6,515.63. Other significant decliners included PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN), PT Astra International Tbk (ASII), and PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMN), with their share prices falling 6.18%, 4.06%, and 1.53%, respectively.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Launches Repurchase Agreement Transaction Feature to Boost Debt Securities Market Liquidity
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has launched a repurchase agreement transaction feature on its Alternative Market Operator System, allowing investors to trade government securities repurchase agreements on a single platform, which is expected to strengthen liquidity in the debt securities market. The feature, known as SPPA, has seen a 76% increase in transactions to IDR 246.1 trillion in 2024, with a 95% increase in users to 39 institutions, and is expected to play a key role in digitalizing financial markets in Indonesia.

title: Indonesian capital market raises IDR 187.04 billion from IPOs and sukuk issuances despite Jakarta Composite Index decline.
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange recorded IDR 187.04 billion in capital raised last week, driven by two initial public offerings from PT Sinar Terang Mandiri Tbk and PT Jantra Grupo Indonesia Tbk, which raised IDR 132.24 billion and IDR 53.1 billion, respectively. Meanwhile, PT Cimb Niaga Auto Finance issued IDR 1.6 billion in sukuk wakalah bi al-istitsmar berkelanjutan I phase II/2025, contributing to a total of IDR 27.92 trillion in bond sukuk issuances listed on the IDX this year, despite the Jakarta Composite Index being down 7.97% since the beginning of the year.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Aims to Reach 200,000 Islamic Stock Investors by 2025
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange aims to reach 200,000 Islamic stock investors by 2025, a 2% increase from the 196,000 investors reached by the end of 2024, with 90% of Sharia stock investors coming from the 17-35 age group. Despite only 19% of total Islamic stock investors being active, experts like Sandiaga Salahuddin Uno of PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk (SRTG) believe Islamic stocks in Indonesia have great potential, particularly in energy sectors, making them a suitable choice for long-term investors seeking halal and sustainable investments.

title: MB Crusher Prioritizes Customer Satisfaction with Comprehensive After-Sales Service for Mining Equipment.
body: MB Crusher prioritizes customer satisfaction, providing comprehensive after-sales services, including maintenance guidance and spare part availability, to minimize downtime and optimize efficiency in mining operations. By ensuring timely support, MB Crusher aims to enhance its customers' productivity and profitability in the mining sector, particularly in Indonesia's coal mining industry.

title: Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014 Reaches 50% of Target in First Week of Offering
body: Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014 has reached 50% of its IDR 15 trillion quota, with total sales of IDR 7.47 trillion, in its first week of offering. The two-year tenor has sold 55.19% or IDR 6.07 trillion of its IDR 11 trillion quota, while the four-year tenor has sold 35.14% or IDR 1.4 trillion of its IDR 4 trillion quota.

title: Government holds closed-door meeting at luxury hotel to discuss revisions to National Army Law, sparking criticism from civil society coalition.
body: The Indonesian government, led by President Prabowo Subianto, has been criticized for holding a meeting to discuss revisions to the National Defense Law at a 5-star hotel, Fairmont, Jakarta, despite implementing strict budget cuts. The move has been condemned by the Civil Society Coalition for Security Sector Reform, with no significant financial outcomes reported.

title: Competition in Indonesia's taxi business is expected to intensify with the emergence of new players.
body: The Indonesian transportation business, particularly the taxi industry, is expected to become increasingly competitive with the emergence of new players, posing a challenge to existing businesses, especially during the peak mobility season of Ramadan and Lebaran. New entrants, such as Evista and Xanh SM, are attempting to capture market share from established companies like Grab (GRAB), Gojek, Maxim, Blue Bird, and Gamya.

title: Jakarta Stock Market Index Falls 1.81% in Second Week of March 2025 After Previous Week's Gain
body: The Indonesian stock market, measured by the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG), fell 1.81% in the second week of March 2025, reversing the 5.83% gain in the previous week. The decline marks a setback for the market, which had shown strength in the first week of the month.

title: Indonesia's 2025 State Budget Realization Records Deficit of Rp 31.2 Trillion as of February 2025.
body: Indonesia's 2025 state budget realization as of February 2025 showed a deficit of IDR 31.2 trillion (0.13% of GDP), with tax revenue of IDR 316.9 trillion and state expenditure of IDR 348.1 trillion. Compared to the same period in 2024, tax revenue decreased by 21.48% year-on-year, while state expenditure decreased by 7%.

title: Michelin extends voluntary tender offer period for Multistrada Arah Sarana shares.
body: Compagnie Générale des Établissements Michelin (ML) has extended the voluntary tender offer period for PT Multistrada Arah Sarana Tbk (MTRA) shares, from March 15, 2025, to April 13, 2025. The extension allows more time for shareholders to participate in the tender offer, which is a significant development for the company's future.

title: Indonesian Palm Oil Association Calls for Government Support to Ensure Industry Stability and Growth.
body: Indonesia's palm oil industry, which employs around 16.2 million people, contributed $14.43 billion to the country's non-oil gas exports of $181.14 billion as of September 2024, playing a significant role in the national economy. The industry saw a 1.69% positive growth in the third quarter of 2024, with the country's overall economic growth reaching 4.95% during the same period.

title: Main Stock Indices in Indonesia Close in the Red on Friday Trading.
body: The main stock indices at the Indonesia Stock Exchange closed in the red on Friday, including the LQ45 Index which fell 1.53%, due to the poor performance of its constituent stocks. This decline reflects the struggling stock market, with no specific company mentioned.

title: Financial Authority to Introduce Co-Insurance Policy to Curb Rising Health Insurance Claims Amidst High Medical Inflation.
body: Indonesia's insurance industry is struggling with rising health insurance claims due to high medical inflation, prompting the Financial Services Authority to take measures to control claim sizes, including designing co-insurance regulations that would require policyholders to share the risk with insurers. This move is expected to help regulate claim amounts and mitigate the industry's financial burden.

title: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi TBK Emerges as a Top Choice for Investors Seeking Strong Financial Performance and Good ESG Practices.
body: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk (EMTK) is a top choice for investors seeking companies with good financial performance and strong Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) ratings, as it has one of the best ESG scores on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. With a strong ESG track record, EMTK offers an attractive investment opportunity for those looking to combine financial returns with social responsibility.

title: PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk implicated in discrepancy of oil measurement findings.
body: PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk (SIMP) is affected by the discovery of discrepancies in the measurement of palm oil, which may impact its financial performance. The company's financial metrics are likely to be influenced by this development, although the exact impact is yet to be determined.

title: Financial Services Authority Gives Illegal Pawnshop Companies Until 2026 to Obtain Licenses.
body: The Financial Services Authority (OJK) has given illegal pawnshop companies until 2026 to obtain licenses, intensifying competition in the industry. OJK's Head of Executive, Friderica Widyasari Dewi, stated that many unlicensed pawnshop companies are still operating, and the authority is working to address this issue.

title: Indonesian Government to Closely Monitor Global Economic Dynamics Amid Rising Recession Risks.
body: Indonesian Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto stated that the government will continue to monitor global economic dynamics, including the new US economic policy on tariffs, despite some countries facing higher recession risks. According to Bloomberg data, Indonesia's recession probability remains low at less than 5% as of February 2025, lower than countries like Mexico, Canada, and others.

title: Bank Indonesia Reports Foreign Capital Outflow of IDR 10.15 Trillion from Domestic Financial Market in Second Week of March 2025.
body: Bank Indonesia reported a capital outflow of Rp 10.15 trillion from the domestic financial market during the second week of March 2025, with the largest outflow of Rp 5.25 trillion occurring in the state securities market. The outflow was driven by non-residents selling a net Rp 1.92 trillion in stocks, Rp 5.25 trillion in state securities, and Rp 2.97 trillion in rupiah-denominated bank securities.

title: Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr Spending Expected to be Lower This Year, Impacting Local and National Economy.
body: The circulation of money during Ramadan and Lebaran this year is expected to be lower than last year, with Bank Indonesia providing only Rp 180.9 trillion in cash, a 1.6% decrease from last year's Rp 183.8 trillion. This decline is expected to impact the national and regional economies, according to M. Rizal Taufikurahman, Head of the Center for Macroeconomics, Finance Institute for Development Economics.

title: Indonesia's Tax Refund Realization Surges 93% to IDR 111.04 Trillion by February 2025.
body: The Directorate General of Taxes, Ministry of Finance, reported a significant increase in tax refunds, reaching IDR 111.04 trillion by February 2025, a 93.11% surge compared to the same period last year, which was IDR 57.5 trillion. This notable growth in tax refunds indicates a positive trend in the country's tax collection and refund process.

title: Autopedia Sukses Lestari Targets Increased Used Car Sales Ahead of Lebaran 2025.
body: PT Autopedia Sukses Lestari Tbk (ASLC) is optimistic about increasing revenue this year, driven by growing demand for used cars ahead of Lebaran 2025, and expects to outperform last year's sales. The company's automotive business, which includes car and motorcycle auctions, online sales, and price data provision, is poised to capitalize on the trend and boost sales.

title: PLN Indonesia Power Records Highest Electricity Sales in Five Years, Reaching 83,082 Gigawatt Hours in 2024.
body: PLN Indonesia Power (no ticker) recorded its highest electricity sales in five years, reaching 83,082 gigawatt hours in 2024, driven by increasing demand from the growing use of electric vehicles and electronic devices. The company's total installed net capacity has reached 19.5 gigawatts, with sales growing steadily from 33,264 GWh in 2020 to 83,082 GWh in 2024, with 27,528 subsidized household connections.

title: BP Tapera Records 27,528 Subsidized Housing Units Distributed Through Liquidity Facility Scheme from January to March 2025.
body: Badan Pengelola Tabungan Perumahan Rakyat (BP Tapera) reported that 27,528 subsidized housing units were distributed through the Liquidity Facility for Housing Financing scheme from January 1 to March 13, 2025, with a total of 129,953 units realized from October 20, 2024, to March 13, 2025. The total value of subsidized housing financing has reached Rp 71.45 trillion since 2022, with an occupancy rate of 93.62% as of last year.

title: Indonesia's Petrochemical Industry Still Heavily Reliant on Imports Despite Growing Demand
body: Indonesia's petrochemical industry still heavily relies on imports, with over 55% of domestic demand met through imports, and local production remains limited, despite growing demand for petrochemical products such as polyethylene and polypropylene. PT Chandra Asri Petrochemical Tbk (TPIA) is investing $380 million to build a new polyethylene plant with a capacity of 400 kilo tons per year, expected to be completed by the end of 2019, to meet growing domestic demand.

title: Government Considers 30% Toll Discount for Early Departures During Lebaran Holiday
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Public Works is considering offering a 30% discount on toll road tariffs for early departures during the upcoming Lebaran holiday to alleviate traffic congestion. Currently, PT Jasa Marga (JSMR) has implemented a 20% discount on toll tariffs on several toll roads, and the new policy aims to further reduce congestion.

title: Middle-class families in Indonesia are increasingly at risk of falling into poverty due to declining purchasing power and economic uncertainty.
body: In Indonesia, the middle-class population is declining, with only 47.85 million people in 2024, down from 57.33 million in 2019, and is projected to further decrease to 46.9 million this year, or even 44.7 million if the government implements policies that suppress purchasing power. Meanwhile, consumer savings rates have hit a two-year low, with only 14.7% of income allocated to savings in February, and the government's decision to delay salary increases for civil servants has reduced potential income for many people.

title: Chinese Production Surge and New Regulations to Impact Indonesian Coal Industry
body: Coal mining companies will continue to face pressure from declining coal prices due to China's increased domestic production, leading to high inventory levels and low prices in 2024. The new regulations in the coal industry, such as royalty tariffs and benchmark prices, will also impact the performance of coal companies, according to Erindra Krisnawan, an analyst at BRI Danareksa Sekuritas (BRI).

title: Foreign investors sell Indonesian bank stocks worth IDR 1.8 trillion ahead of annual shareholders meeting.
body: Foreign investors sold IDR 1.8 trillion worth of bank stocks in the past week, but some brokers, such as JP Morgan Sekuritas and UBS Sekuritas Indonesia, have started buying, with net purchases of IDR 1.39 trillion and IDR 208.64 billion, respectively, in PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) and PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI) stocks. Despite the buying interest, analysts remain cautious due to global economic uncertainty and concerns over the Indonesian government's policies, which may impact bank stocks, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) still vulnerable to correction.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Predicted to Continue Correction Due to External and Domestic Sentiment.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) is expected to remain under pressure today, influenced by negative sentiments from external and domestic factors, with a predicted range of 4,420-4,380 and resistance at 4,480-4,510. The index closed at 4,446.458 yesterday, its lowest level since November 16, with foreign investors selling a net Rp1.4 trillion worth of shares, amid concerns over China's economic development and the upcoming Fed fund rate hike.

title: Chandra Asri Pacific Targets Fourfold Revenue Growth by 2025 Following Shell Energy Chemicals Park Acquisition
body: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (TPIA) targets a fourfold increase in revenue by 2025, driven by the acquisition of Shell Energy Chemicals Park in Singapore, which is currently in the finalization process with partner Glencore Plc (GLEN). The company expects a significant revenue boost if the acquisition is completed by Q2-2025, according to Edi Rivai, Director of Legal, External Relations, and Circular Economy at Chandra Asri Group.

title: Government to Implement Higher Royalty Tariffs for Mineral and Coal Despite Business Objections
body: The Indonesian government's plan to increase royalty tariffs for mineral and coal businesses remains unchanged, with the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources awaiting government regulation approval to implement the policy. The move is expected to impact companies in the sector, including ABM Investama (ABMM), which has already stopped consolidating revenue from its Aceh coal mine.

title: Undisbursed loans in Indonesia's major banks reach Rp 879.93 trillion in January 2025, with Bank Central Asia and Bank Mandiri having the largest amounts.
body: As of January 2025, undisbursed loans at major Indonesian banks, including Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA), Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), reached Rp 879.93 trillion, with Bank Mandiri Tbk experiencing the largest growth of 20.91% year-over-year. Despite this, Bank Mandiri Tbk's corporate secretary remains optimistic about loan disbursement, projecting 10-12% annual growth in consolidated credit by the end of 2025, driven by strong economic conditions and growing consumer demand.

title: Indonesian Government Sets Reference Prices for Coal and Minerals for Second Half of March 2025.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has set the benchmark price for coal for the second period of March 2025, which will serve as a reference for coal businesses in their transactions, including exports. The ministry has also set the benchmark price for minerals for the same period, as outlined in Ministerial Decree No. 92.K/MB.01/MEM.B/2025, effective from March 15, 2025.

title: Vinfast delivers 2,500 electric vehicles to Indonesia, marking significant milestone in its expansion into the country's EV market.
body: Vinfast has shipped 2,500 electric vehicles to Indonesia, its largest shipment yet, as part of its $1 billion investment commitment to develop 100,000 EV charging units across the country, with a focus on Java Island. The company is also building an assembly plant in West Java with an annual production capacity of 50,000 units, and exploring investments in wind and solar power plants to support Indonesia's green energy transition.

title: Indonesia collects over RP 26 trillion in value-added tax from digital transactions over five years.
body: Indonesia has collected RP 26.18 trillion in value-added tax from digital transactions over the past five years, with contributions from digital companies such as Meta (META), Google (GOOGL), Microsoft (MSFT), and Amazon (AMZN). The government has also generated significant tax revenue from cryptocurrency transactions (RP 1.21 trillion), fintech lending (RP 3.23 trillion), and government procurement (RP 2.94 trillion), aiming to create a level playing field between traditional and digital businesses.

title: PT Lautan Luas TBK's Share Price Remains Unchanged Following Vice President Director's Resignation
body: PT Lautan Luas Tbk (LTLS) shares remained stagnant at IDR 950 on Monday, following the resignation of Vice President Director Jimmy Masrin last week, with the stock declining 4.04% over the past week and 5.47% over the last month. The company's director, Joshua Chandra Asali, assured that Masrin's resignation would not have a material impact on the company's operations, finances, or business continuity, citing strong corporate governance mechanisms.

title: Apexindo Pratama Duta secures USD 119.6 million offshore drilling contract from Pertamina Hulu Mahakam.
body: PT Apexindo Pratama Duta Tbk (APEX) has secured a USD 119.6 million offshore drilling contract from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam, expected to generate approximately USD 34.3 million in annual revenue over 3.5 years, boosting the company's rig utilization and revenue. In Q3 2024, Apexindo recorded a 29.6% year-on-year revenue increase to USD 60.8 million, but its net profit dropped 12% to USD 972,000, with net profit margins shrinking to 1.6%.

title: Indika Energy to Invest $10 Million in Nanshan Aluminium's IPO on Hong Kong Stock Exchange.
body: PT Indika Energy Tbk will invest USD 10 million in Nanshan Aluminium International Holdings Limited's initial public offering on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange through its subsidiary, PT Perkasa Investama Mineral, as a cornerstone investor. The investment, scheduled for March 25, 2025, aims to enhance operational capabilities, diversify the portfolio, and expand the company's presence in international markets.

title: President Prabowo Subianto pledges to tackle gold smuggling and mining irregularities to protect Indonesia's finances.
body: President Prabowo Subianto has pledged to address gold smuggling and other mining commodity irregularities that harm Indonesia's finances, vowing to take action against illegal mining and smuggling that occur without proper processes. The government aims to manage the country's mining wealth properly, investigating and eradicating all forms of irregularities that threaten domestic industries.

title: PT Nanotech Indonesia's shareholder PT Nanotech Riset Investama divests 5.72% of total shares, worth IDR 5.64 billion.
body: PT Nanotech Riset Investama, a shareholder of PT Nanotech Indonesia Global TBK (NANO), divested 245 million shares (5.72% of total shares) at IDR 23 per share, amounting to IDR 5.64 billion, reducing its shareholding to 205 million shares. Following the transaction, NANO's shares rose 6.9% to IDR 31 per share, with a 29.17% gain over the past five days.

title: Japanese company launches groundbreaking plant-based racing engine oil that reduces carbon footprint by 82 percent while delivering high-performance results.
body: Idemitsu Kosan (IDEMITSU) has launched a groundbreaking racing engine oil, Idemitsu IFG Plantech Racing, made from over 80% plant-based materials, which reduces carbon footprint by 82% compared to conventional mineral oils, and offers exceptional performance with 194% greater toughness, 50% lower friction, and 169% enhanced protection. The company plans to roll out this product in several regions, including the United States, Brazil, Mexico, and China, with the goal of making plant-based solutions a standard feature in the quest to reduce the automotive industry's carbon footprint.

title: Indomobil to Introduce New Chinese Electric Vehicle Brand to Indonesian Market
body: PT Indomobil Sukses Internasional Tbk (INDO) is set to introduce a new Chinese electric vehicle brand to Indonesia through its subsidiary, PT Indomobil National Distributor, with CEO Tan Kim Piauw revealing that the company has been in communication with various brands, including those under the Stellantis group. The new brand is expected to enter the Indonesian electric vehicle market soon, marking a significant development in the country's growing EV industry.

title: Aneka Petroindo Raya Sees Surge in Fuel Sales Following Expansion and Promotions.
body: PT Aneka Petroindo Raya (no ticker mentioned) has seen a surge in fuel sales over the past few weeks, driven by the company's expansion with the opening of three new public fuel stations in the last 30 days and more aggressive promotions. This growth in sales is a significant outcome for the company, indicating a positive trend in its financial metrics.

title: President Prabowo Subianto inaugurates $630 million precious metal refinery facility in East Java.
body: PT Freeport Indonesia's (Freeport) precious metal refinery in Gresik, East Java, was inaugurated by President Prabowo Subianto, with a total construction cost of $630 million or IDR 10 trillion. The copper smelter, the largest single-line design in the world, has a capacity to process 1.7 million tons of copper concentrate and produce 600,000-700,000 tons of copper cathodes per year, with by-products including gold, silver, and other precious metals.

title: Government Ensures Adequate Fuel Supply at Public Gas Stations During Peak Lebaran Season
body: During the peak season of Idul Fitri, the Indonesian government ensured adequate fuel supply at Pertamina (PERTM) and private gas stations, with the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources providing permits for a three-month period to guarantee stock availability. This move aimed to meet the increased fuel consumption demand during the holiday season, with no significant disruptions or shortages reported.

title: Government's Plan to Increase Royalty Tariffs on Minerals and Coal Sparks Controversy Among Mining Operators
body: The Indonesian government's plan to increase royalty tariffs on minerals and coal has sparked controversy, with the Nickel Miners Association of Indonesia warning that it could lead to the closure of nickel mines, as the increased royalty would significantly reduce production margins. The association's secretary-general, Meidy Katrin Lengkey, stated that if the 14% royalty rate is applied, some mining business licenses would be better off closing down rather than producing at a loss.

title: Lebaran Holiday Season Expected to Boost Demand for Vehicles and Automotive Components in Indonesia.
body: The upcoming Eid al-Fitr holiday season is expected to boost demand for vehicles and supporting components in Indonesia, driven by increased mobility and community activities during the period. Astra International (ASII) anticipates that this momentum will drive up vehicle sales, aligning with the growing needs of the community during the holiday season.

title: Bank Indonesia's benchmark interest rate decision this week unlikely to change banking liquidity conditions.
body: Bank Indonesia's decision on the benchmark interest rate this week is not expected to change the liquidity condition of banks, with funding costs predicted to remain high. Despite two rate cuts since September 2024, deposit interest rates have not decreased, with the average deposit interest rate still ranging from 4% to 5%.

title: Businesses in Indonesia Face Classic Problem of Extortion by Community Organizations Ahead of Idul Fitri Celebrations
body: The activities of certain organizations (ormas) in Indonesia, who demand THR (holiday allowance) from businesses, have caused investment losses of up to hundreds of trillions of rupiah, affecting industrial areas in Karawang, Bekasi, East Java, and Batam. The government is urged to take action to address this issue, including reviewing and revoking permits of problematic ormas, to prevent further harm to the social and economic climate.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Announces Plan to Develop 30 Large-Scale Downstream Projects
body: President Prabowo Subianto announced plans to develop 30 large-scale downstream projects, aiming to create up to 8 million jobs, with a focus on strategic sectors such as agriculture and fisheries that can generate significant foreign exchange earnings and employment opportunities. The government has already mapped out the projects, which will begin this year, building on the initial target of 20 projects across various sectors beyond mining.

title: PT Panca Budi Idaman Tbk Expects to Maintain Growth Momentum Until 2025
body: PT Panca Budi Idaman Tbk (PBID) reported a 11.48% year-over-year increase in net sales to Rp 5.24 trillion in 2024, driven by growth in its plastic packaging business. The company is optimistic about sustaining its performance growth throughout 2025, following a strong financial report that showed an increase in both sales and net profit last year.

title: Indonesian Truckers Association to Halt Operations Ahead of Official Ban, Raising Concerns Over National Supply Chain Disruptions.
body: The Indonesian Truck Entrepreneurs Association's decision to halt operational activities starting March 20, 2025, has raised concerns among various parties, potentially disrupting national supply chains, particularly in the distribution of essential goods and food supplies ahead of the Lebaran holiday. This move may have significant implications for the logistics and transportation industries, affecting the overall economy and investments.

title: Indonesian Government Plans to Lift Moratorium on Migrant Workers to Saudi Arabia by March 2025.
body: The Indonesian government plans to lift the moratorium on sending migrant workers to Saudi Arabia, with the policy expected to take effect on March 20, 2025, pending no obstacles. The Ministry of Manpower and Transmigration will prepare training for migrant workers to be sent to Saudi Arabia, following President Prabowo Subianto's approval of the moratorium lift.

title: Bank Indonesia Launches QRIS Tap for Efficient and Effective Transactions
body: Bank Indonesia is set to launch QRIS Tap on March 14, 2025, a technology that enables contactless transactions using near-field communication, initially available in transportation, parking, hospitals, and retail, with plans to expand to other merchants. The implementation of QRIS Tap is expected to increase efficiency and effectiveness in transactions, with users only needing to bring their devices close to the payment terminal to complete a transaction.

title: Indonesian economy shows mixed signals with positive manufacturing index but declining consumer confidence and purchasing power.
body: Indonesia's economy is showing signs of weakness, with a 0.48% monthly deflation rate in February, a 2.17% household credit growth rate, and a 1.7% depreciation of the rupiah against the US dollar, despite a positive Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) of 53.6. Experts warn that the economy is not doing well, citing declining retail sales, increasing layoffs, and decreasing consumer confidence, and suggest that the government needs to provide stimulus to boost consumer purchasing power.

title: Indonesian Home Loan Growth Slows Amid Economic Slowdown.
body: Outstanding mortgages in Indonesia's banking sector reached IDR 793.6 trillion in January 2025, growing 10.8% year-over-year, a slower pace compared to the 12.59% growth in the same period last year. The growth slowdown is attributed to weakening consumer purchasing power amidst an economic slowdown, leading to an increase in problematic housing loans.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.67% to 6,471.95, Extending Three-Day Losing Streak.
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.67% or 43.68 points to 6,471.95 on Monday, marking its third consecutive day of decline, with a total loss of 1.91% over the past week and 8.59% since the beginning of the year.

title: Indonesia's trade surplus narrows to $3.13 billion in February 2025.
body: Indonesia's trade surplus narrowed to $3.13 billion in February 2025, down $380 million from the previous month, but up $2.28 billion from the same period last year, driven by non-oil and gas commodities such as palm oil, mineral fuels, and iron and steel. Despite the surplus, Indonesia's export value fell 2.58% to $21.95 billion, while imports rose 5.18% to $18.86 billion, with economists warning that the trade surplus may continue to shrink due to declining commodity prices and export restrictions.

title: Banks in Indonesia Face Increasing Burden of Higher Funding Costs and Regulatory Fees.
body: Indonesian banks are facing increasing burdens, including high cost of funds and intense liquidity competition, as well as rising regulatory fees, including a new premium restructuring program that will require bi-annual payments to the deposit insurance agency starting in 2025. This added expense is expected to further strain the banking sector's financial metrics.

title: PT Austindo Nusantara Jaya to be Acquired by PT Ciliandra Perkasa, a Subsidiary of First Resources Pte Ltd.
body: PT Austindo Nusantara Jaya Tbk, a palm oil company, is set to have a new controller after PT Ciliandra Perkasa, a subsidiary of First Resources Pte. Ltd., acquires its shares from the Tahija family, marking a significant change in ownership.

title: Elnusa Allocates Rp 594 Billion for Capital Expenditure to Strengthen Main Business Segments
body: PT Elnusa Tbk (ELNUSA) has allocated Rp 594 billion for capital expenditure this year, with 56.4% going towards upstream & support services, 30.3% towards energy distribution & logistics, and 13.3% towards non-project and new business development. The company, a subsidiary of Grup Pertamina, aims to strengthen its main business segments with this investment.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.67% Due to Rupiah Depreciation and Foreign Investor Withdrawal.
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.67% or 43.6 points to 6,471.95 on Monday, driven by the depreciation of the rupiah against the US dollar and foreign investors withdrawing funds from the Indonesian market. According to Oktavianus Audi, VP of Marketing, Strategy, and Planning at Kiwoom Sekuritas, this decline is a result of these factors.

title: Barito Pacific's 2024 Financial Performance Sees Revenue Decline but Net Profit Soars Due to Efficiency.
body: PT Barito Pacific Tbk (BRPT) reported a 13.5% year-over-year decline in revenue to $2.38 billion in 2024, mainly due to scheduled maintenance and global supply and demand disruptions. Despite the revenue drop, BRPT's net profit surged thanks to efficiency efforts, highlighting the company's resilience in the face of challenges.

title: Indonesia's Finance Ministry Launches Initiatives to Optimize Tax Revenue in 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Finance aims to increase tax revenue in 2025 through various initiatives, including a joint program to target 2,000 tax evaders, digitalization of tax administration, and intensification of non-tax state revenue. However, experts question the effectiveness of these measures, citing limitations in increasing tax revenue and the need for new tax objects to boost revenue.

title: PT Cisarua Mountain Dairy's 2025 Performance Predicted to be Conservative Due to Weakened Consumer Spending and Sugar Tax Anticipation.
body: PT Cisarua Mountain Dairy Tbk (CMRY) is expected to experience conservative growth in 2025 due to weakened consumer purchasing power and anticipated sugar tax increases, but its effective marketing and distribution strategies may still support its performance. Despite the challenges, CMRY's revenue remains strong, reaching Rp 2.4 trillion in Q4-2024, with a 7.6% quarterly growth and 17.6% year-over-year growth.

title: Major Currencies Outperform US Dollar Amid Economic Concerns and Monetary Policy Shifts
body: The majority of major currencies have outperformed the US dollar, driven by concerns over the US economy and monetary policy, with the euro, pound, Australian dollar, yen, and yuan expected to strengthen. The dollar index is predicted to range between 108-110 by the end of 2025, while the yen is expected to reach 140 by year-end, with investors advised to diversify their assets to mitigate uncertainty.

title: Pt Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk prioritizes environmental, social, and governance aspects through business innovations and diversification into renewable energy sector.
body: PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk (formerly PT Adaro Energy Indonesia Tbk) has diversified its business into the renewable energy sector, with ongoing projects including a 1.4 gigawatt hydroelectric power plant and a solar power plant, as part of its Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) strategy. The company recorded revenue of USD 2.07 billion last year, with coal sales to third parties growing 16.63% year-on-year to USD 699.65 million, despite a slight decline from USD 2.13 billion in 2023.

title: Bumi Resources Welcomes Proposed Adjustment to Coal Royalty Fees
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) welcomes the proposed adjustment to coal royalty fees by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, which could lead to a significant reduction in royalty tariffs from the current 28% rate, benefiting the company's operations. The company targets coal production of 80 million tons by 2025, with production already increasing year-on-year, and expects the new regulation to have a positive impact on its operations.

title: PT Freeport Indonesia to Invest $500 Million Annually for 7-8 Years in New Underground Mine at Grasberg.
body: PT Freeport Indonesia (FCX) is investing approximately USD 500 million per year over the next 7-8 years to develop its new underground mine, Kucing Liar, at Grasberg, Papua, which is expected to produce 7 billion tons of copper and 6 million ounces of gold per year until 2041. The mine, set to begin production in 2027, will replace declining output from the Deep Mill Level Zone and help maintain stable ore production of 240,000 tons per day.

title: PT Vale Indonesia sets 2025 as crucial year to complete three strategic nickel processing projects.
body: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (PTVI.JK) aims to complete three strategic projects by 2025, including the development of new mining operations in three provinces and a downstream processing plant, with a total investment of around USD 9 billion. The projects, which will create around 5,000 jobs, are expected to be completed between 2026 and 2027, with the Pomalaa and Morowali plants targeted for completion in 2026 and the Sorowako Limonite project in 2027.

title: PT Bukit Asam targets completion of Tanjung Enim-Kramasan coal transportation development by Q3 2026.
body: PT Bukit Asam Tbk. (PTBA) aims to complete the Tanjung Enim-Kramasan coal transportation development project by Q3 2026, which is expected to increase its production capacity by 20 million metric tons, with a capital expenditure of IDR 7 trillion, significantly higher than its five-year average capex of IDR 2.5 trillion. The company's cash reserves are estimated at IDR 5.7 trillion by the end of 2024, but it may face challenges in financing dividends and capex in 2025, which can be overcome if revenue exceeds expectations or additional funding is secured.

title: PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk, PT Emas Murni Abadi, and PT Gorontalo Minerals sign agreement for gold refining and buying-selling collaboration.
body: PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta), PT Emas Murni Abadi, and PT Gorontalo Minerals have signed a collaboration agreement for gold refining and buying/selling activities, with a total refining and purchasing capacity of 5,711 kg per year. This collaboration is expected to strengthen HRta's position in the precious metals market and boost operational performance, with no material transaction or conflict of interest reported.

title: PT Sinar Terang Mandiri TBK raises IDR 132.3 billion in initial public offering to optimize nickel mining business.
body: PT Sinar Terang Mandiri Tbk (no ticker provided) raised IDR 132.3 billion in funding through its initial public offering, with an oversubscription rate of 25 times, and plans to use the majority of the funds to strengthen its fundamentals and capitalize on opportunities in the nickel mining sector. The company reported a 40.8% increase in revenue to IDR 1.36 trillion as of August 31, 2024, driven by a 47.0% increase in total material movement from nickel mining, and aims to further enhance its revenue through the expansion of its heavy equipment fleet.

title: Indonesia to Develop Coal Downstreaming Project into Dimethyl Ether in South Sumatra and Kalimantan
body: The Indonesian government plans to develop a coal downstreaming project through gasification into dimethyl ether (DME) in South Sumatra and Kalimantan, with the goal of reducing LPG import costs and subsidies. However, the project has faced criticism due to its high production costs and uneconomical nature, with experts warning that it could lead to a national economic loss of IDR 33.8 trillion per year and burden the state's finances with additional gas subsidies.

title: PT Graha Prima Mentari's revenue surges 130.42% in 2024, but net profit falls 42.42% due to increased cost of goods sold.
body: PT Graha Prima Mentari Tbk (GRPM) reported a 130.42% surge in revenue to IDR 705.50 billion in 2024, driven by strong sales in its food beverage and care products segments, but its net profit fell 42.42% to IDR 2.55 billion due to rising cost of goods sold. Despite the decline in net profit, the company's operating profit and profit before income tax increased by 19.64% and 12.44%, respectively.

title: Bank Syariah Indonesia Director Harry Gusti Utama Buys 20,000 Company Shares Worth IDR 50 Million
body: Harry Gusti Utama, Director of PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BRIS), purchased 20,000 shares of the company at IDR 2,500 per share, investing IDR 50 million, marking his first direct ownership investment in the company. Despite this, BRIS shares dropped 2.39% to IDR 2,450 per share, extending its year-to-date decline to 11.87%.

title: Aims Indo Investama's controlling shareholder sells 5.2% of its shares, earning IDR 3.04 billion.
body: PT Aims Indo Investama (AII) secured IDR 3.04 billion by divesting 5.2% of its shares in PT Artha Mahiya Investama Tbk, selling 11.44 million shares at IDR 266 per share, decreasing its stake from 145.77 million shares to 134.33 million shares. Meanwhile, AII's shares dropped 16.32% to IDR 318 per share, with a trading volume of 21.43 million shares valued at IDR 8.08 billion.

title: Rebecca Halim increases ownership in PT Erajaya Swasembada through PT Eralink Internasional.
body: Rebecca Halim, wife of Sugianto Kusuma, increased her ownership in PT Erajaya Swasembada Tbk (ERAA) by purchasing 65.88 million shares through PT Eralink Internasional at prices between IDR 360 and IDR 364 per share, raising her stake from 54.51% to 54.93%. The transaction, valued at IDR 23.8 billion, is part of a direct investment to increase share ownership, according to Amelia Allen, Head of Legal & Corporate Secretary of ERAA.

title: Indonesian lawmakers visit stock exchange to monitor market movement after composite index drops 5%.
body: The Indonesia Composite Index (IHSG) dropped 5% during the first trading session, prompting the stock exchange authority, PT Bursa Efek Indonesia (IDX), to temporarily halt the system. Trading resumed 30 minutes later without any changes to the trading schedule, with the IHSG still down 5% at the time of resumption.

title: OECD Lowers Indonesia's 2025 Economic Growth Projection to 4.9 Percent
body: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) has lowered its projection for Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 to 4.9%, down from its previous estimate of 5.2%, indicating a slower-than-expected growth. This revised forecast suggests that Indonesia's economic growth may not be able to sustain a 5% level, painting a less optimistic picture for the country's economy.

title: Individual investors increase their stakes in several Indonesian stocks in March 2025.
body: In March 2025, at least nine individual investors with over 5% ownership in certain stocks increased their stakes in 11 different stocks, with Djoni being the most active, buying 350 million shares of PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk (SANO), 250 million shares of PT Menn Teknologi Indonesia Tbk (MENN), and 109.312 million shares of PT Techno9 Indonesia Tbk (TECH). This significant accumulation of shares by individual investors suggests a bullish sentiment in the Indonesian stock market.

title: PGN Explores Gas Supply and Infrastructure Development in Jatengland Industrial Area
body: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) is exploring the provision of gas supply and infrastructure in the Jatengland industrial area, Central Java, to support the government's target of increasing industrial competitiveness through the use of natural gas. The company is optimistic about the collaboration, which will initially use the beyond pipeline mode, to realize the supply of natural gas to Jatengland.

title: Pertamina to Start Bioavtur Production Trials Using Used Cooking Oil in Q2 2025
body: PT Kilang Pertamina Internasional (PERTamina) will start testing bioavtur production using used cooking oil as raw material in Q2 2025 at its Cilacap refinery, targeting an initial production of 9,000 barrels per day. This bioavtur production is expected to be a solution for airlines that need to meet clean energy standards, according to Direktur Utama KPI Taufik Aditiyawarman.

title: Government Ensures Royalty Tariff Hike in Mining Sector Won't Harm Industry
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is confident that the policy to increase royalty tariffs in the mineral and coal mining sector will not harm the industry, as the government has conducted a thorough evaluation before implementing the policy. The ministry believes that the mining industry is crucial for the country's economy, particularly in supporting the acceleration of economic growth through downstreaming.

title: Indonesia's Coal Export Value Drops 3.68% in February 2025
body: Indonesia's coal export value decreased in February 2025, reaching $2.09 billion, a 3.68% month-to-month decline from $2.17 billion in January 2025, according to data from the Central Statistics Agency. This decline is expected to impact non-tax state revenue from mineral and coal royalties, said Fathul Nugroho, Vice Chairman of the Indonesian Association of Energy, Mineral, and Coal Suppliers.

title: Indonesian Commercial Vehicle Industry Faces Pressure in Early 2025 Amid Economic and Regulatory Challenges
body: In January 2025, Indonesia's commercial vehicle sales, including trucks, decreased by 4% to 4,650 units, while overall car sales plummeted by 11.3% to 61,843 units, according to the Indonesian Automotive Industry Association. Despite economic and regulatory challenges, commercial vehicle brand agents are seeking growth opportunities in the national automotive market.

title: Indonesian Stock Market to Close for Six Days for Idul Fitri Holiday
body: The Indonesian stock market will be closed for six trading days, from March 28 to April 4, 2025, to observe the Idulfitri holiday. During this period, market activities will come to a halt, affecting trading and investment decisions in the country.

title: Weha Transportasi Indonesia's revenue reaches all-time high of Rp 304 billion in 2024, up 14% from previous year.
body: PT Weha Transportasi Indonesia Tbk (WEHA) reported a revenue of IDR 304 billion in 2024, a 14% increase from IDR 267 billion in 2023, marking its highest achievement. However, the company's net profit decreased by 11% year-over-year to IDR 28.3 billion, while its EBITDA increased by 9% to IDR 93 billion from IDR 85 billion in 2023.

title: Big Cap Stocks, Including Banking and Barito Group, Drag Down Jakarta Composite Index by Over 6%
body: The Indonesian stock market's composite index plummeted over 6% intraday on Tuesday, weighed down by big-cap banking stocks and Barito Group shares, with PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII) being the largest contributor to the decline, its 20% drop contributing 38.21 points to the index's fall. The index's sharp decline was led by big-cap banking stocks, which became the main drag on the market.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges 3.84% Amid Negative Sentiment and Trading Halt
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) plummeted 3.84% to 6,223.39 on Tuesday, with a trading halt of 30 minutes implemented by the Indonesia Stock Exchange after a 5% decline in the first session. According to Mirae Asset Sekuritas' senior market analyst Nafan Aji Gusta, the negative sentiment stems from the domestic market awaiting pro-market policies.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Imposes Temporary Trading Halt as Composite Stock Price Index Plunges Over 5 Percent
body: The Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) temporarily halted trading for 30 minutes on Tuesday after the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) plummeted more than 5%, marking the first trading halt since the COVID-19 pandemic crisis; the IHSG eventually closed 3.84% lower at 6,223.38, its weakest level this year.

title: Cleo's Bottled Water Sales Increase During Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr Due to Increased Social Gatherings.
body: PT Sariguna Primatirta Tbk (SRTG), the producer of Cleo bottled water, saw an increase in sales during the Ramadan and Idul Fitri holiday season due to increased gatherings and celebrations. The company benefited from the traditional surge in demand for bottled water during this period, leading to a boost in sales.

title: Summarecon Agung Records 79.29% Annual Increase in Net Profit to IDR 1.37 Trillion in 2024.
body: PT Summarecon Agung Tbk (SUMA) reported a net profit of IDR 1.37 trillion in 2024, a 79.29% year-over-year increase from IDR 765.96 billion in 2023, driven by a 59.53% annual increase in revenue to IDR 10.62 trillion. The significant growth in revenue and profit highlights the company's strong performance in 2024.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges 3.84% Amid Domestic Factors and Downgraded Economic Projections.
body: The Indonesian stock market plummeted 3.84% or 248.55 points to 6,223.38 on Tuesday, driven by domestic factors, despite the strengthening of Asian markets. The decline was preceded by downgrades from MSCI, Fitch Rating, and Goldman Sachs, as well as the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) cutting its 2025 economic growth projection for Indonesia to 4.9% from 5.2%.

title: Bank Indonesia Expected to Maintain 5.75% Interest Rate Amid High Global Uncertainty
body: Bank Indonesia is expected to maintain its benchmark interest rate at 5.75% in its March 2025 meeting, citing high global uncertainty despite expectations of a larger federal funds rate cut by the Fed. The decision is driven by concerns that the impact of the intensifying trade war in March has not yet been reflected in inflation data, according to Josua Pardede, Chief Economist at Bank Permata (BMRI).

title: Indonesia's investment risk premium remains high, signaling investor concerns over the country's financial market.
body: Indonesia's investment risk premium remains high, signaling that investors perceive risks in the country's financial market, with the 5-year credit default swap (CDS) rising to 82.87, up 4.0% in a week and 16.71% in a month. This increase indicates a growing concern among investors about the country's financial stability, leading to a higher risk premium.

title: Indonesian Economy Expected to Grow Slower This Lebaran with Lower Money Circulation
body: The total money circulation during this year's Eid al-Fitr holiday is expected to reach IDR 137,975 trillion, a 12.28% decrease from last year's IDR 157,3 trillion. This decline is attributed to a slower economic growth compared to previous years, according to Sarman Simanjorang, Vice Chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

title: Rupiah Weakens Against US Dollar Amid Stock Market Decline
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened against the US dollar, closing at Rp 16,428 per dollar, a 0.13% daily decline, according to Bloomberg data. The rupiah also fell 0.32% to Rp 16,432 on the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) of Bank Indonesia.

title: Gold price surges to record high of $3,036.70 per ounce amid global trade tensions and Middle East conflict.
body: Gold prices surged 1.01% to a record high of $3,036.70 per ounce, driven by the ongoing trade war between major currencies and continued conflict in the Middle East, solidifying its position as a safe-haven asset.

title: Dharma Satya Nusantara's Performance Expected to Improve Amid Rising Global Crude Palm Oil Prices
body: PT Dharma Satya Nusantara Tbk's performance is expected to improve due to the potential increase in global crude palm oil (CPO) prices, which may reach RM 4,350 per metric ton, driven by limited supply. The company's higher CPO prices, improved fresh fruit bunch productivity, and stable production costs are expected to support its growth, according to Trimegah Sekuritas analyst Kharel Devin Fielim.

title: OECD Cuts Indonesia's 2025 Economic Growth Projection to 4.9%
body: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) has revised its projection for Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 to 4.9%, down from its previous estimate of 5.2%. This downward revision suggests that Indonesia's economic growth may not be able to sustain a 5% level, falling short of its target.

title: Prabowo Subianto's Government Holds Meetings with Business Tycoons and Experts to Restore Public Trust
body: The Indonesian government, led by Prabowo Subianto, is making efforts to restore confidence among various groups, including entrepreneurs, academics, and analysts, through a series of meetings. The first meeting, held over two days, brought together prominent business leaders such as Anthony Salim, Sugianto Kusuma, and Chairul Tanjung, among others, to discuss ways to revitalize the economy.

title: Waskita Karya to Sell 35% Stake in Cimanggis-Cibitung Toll Road to Bakrie Group for Rp 3.3 Trillion to Pay Off Debt.
body: PT Waskita Karya Tbk is undergoing debt restructuring, including selling 35% of its shares in the Cimanggis-Cibitung toll road worth Rp 3.3 trillion to the Bakrie Group, with the proceeds to be used to pay off debts totaling Rp 21 trillion to 21 banking creditors. The company aims to complete the share sale by December, with the offer open to the Bakrie Group until August 1, 2025, and if not taken, will be offered to other parties.

title: Government to Add 2.75 Million Hectares of Protected Rice Fields to Support Food Self-Sufficiency Program
body: The Indonesian government plans to add 2.75 million hectares of protected rice fields to its existing 3.8 million hectares, aiming to support its food self-sufficiency program. This decision was made during a limited coordination meeting at the Ministry of Agriculture, with the goal of preserving rice fields and promoting food security.

title: Rupiah weakens against US dollar, depreciating 0.63% to Rp 16,531.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.63% against the US dollar on Wednesday, closing at Rp 16,531, while the rupiah at Bank Indonesia also fell 0.58% to Rp 16,528. The decline was partly due to the cautious stance of Bank Indonesia, which decided to maintain its interest rate at 5.75% during its recent meeting.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rises 1.42% Despite Rupiah Weakening Against US Dollar
body: The Indonesian stock market continued to fluctuate, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closing at 6,311.66, up 1.42% from the previous day, but the rupiah weakened 0.63% to Rp 16,531 per US dollar in the spot market.

title: PLN Completes 200 Megawatt Solar Power Plant in Ibu Kota Negeri
body: PT PLN (PLN) has completed the construction of a 200-megawatt solar power plant in the capital city, which can produce more energy than the daily consumption in the area. With the completion of this project, 100% of the electricity supply in the area now comes from renewable energy sources.

title: Erick Thohir Appoints Ghimoyo as New Director of PT Rajawali Nusantara Indonesia
body: Menteri BUMN Erick Thohir has appointed Ghimoyo as the new Director of PT Rajawali Nusantara Indonesia (ID Food), replacing Sis Apik Wijayanto, aiming to boost the company's performance as a national food producer and contribute to the government's self-sufficiency target. Ghimoyo, previously CEO of Jhonlin Group, a mining company owned by Haji Isam, is expected to leverage his experience to drive ID Food's growth.

title: 66 Companies Suspected of Fraud in Fuel Distribution in Indonesia
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Trade has identified 66 distributors suspected of fraudulent practices in the distribution of subsidized fuel, with the most common violations being price hikes above the maximum retail price and bundling methods. The ministry's findings are based on surveillance conducted since November 2024, highlighting the need for stricter regulations to prevent such practices.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Meets with Economic Minister to Discuss National Economic Conditions
body: Indonesia's economic fundamentals remain strong, with low inflation in February, a manufacturing PMI index of 53.6, and a 10.3% monthly credit growth in January, as well as a trade surplus of $6.61 billion. The country's economic growth is still competitive compared to others, such as Malaysia and Chile, with one of the lowest inflation rates in ASEAN.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Sentiment Continues to Weigh on Pension Fund Investment Performance
body: Indonesia's financial market remains sluggish at the start of 2025, negatively impacting the investment performance of the pension fund industry, with return on investment (ROI) dropping to 0.52% in January 2025 from 0.61% in January 2024. This decline is reflected in data from the Financial Services Authority, highlighting the ongoing challenges faced by the industry.

title: Government Remains Firm on Implementing New Royalty Tariff Regulation for Mineral and Coal Despite Industry Protests
body: The Indonesian government plans to issue new regulations on mineral and coal royalties before Lebaran 2025, despite opposition from mining companies, which could impact their financial performance. The Director-General of Mineral and Coal, Tri Winarno, acknowledged receiving objections from the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association, but the government remains firm on its decision.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Slips Following Sharp Selloff Amid Global Market Volatility
body: The Jakarta Composite Index opened lower on Wednesday, slipping 0.04% to 6,221.1, following a sharp 3.84% decline on Tuesday that triggered a rare trading halt, with analysts expecting volatility to continue. Meanwhile, the Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.3% against the dollar, making it the worst-performing currency in Asia this year, while gold prices surged past $3,000 per ounce for the first time amid escalating geopolitical risks and uncertainty over US trade policy.

title: PT Platinum Wahab Nusantara Tbk to Expand into International Market with Franchise Opening in Australia in 2025
body: PT Platinum Wahab Nusantara Tbk (TGUK) is expanding into the international market by opening franchises in Australia in Q2 2025, aiming to introduce its Teguk brand globally with a more efficient and competitive business model. The company's stock price surged 17.31% to IDR 61 per share as it implements a turnaround strategy through vertical and horizontal expansion, focusing on high-profit product categories and digital media optimization to counter rising online delivery costs.

title: Hendro Gondokusumo, Indonesian Real Estate Mogul and Founder of Intiland Development, Passes Away in Singapore
body: Hendro Gondokusumo, founder and chairman of Intiland Development (no ticker), passed away, leaving behind a legacy of shaping Indonesia's real estate landscape through pioneering projects and diversification into hospitality, with the company becoming publicly listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange in 1990. Under his leadership, Intiland Development navigated multiple economic crises, including the 1997-98 Asian financial crisis and the COVID-19 pandemic, solidifying his reputation as a real estate mogul.

title: PT Habco Trans Maritima to Strengthen Business Strategy with Rights Issue Plan
body: PT Habco Trans Maritima Tbk (HATM) is reviewing a rights issue plan to strengthen its business strategy, with funds to be used to meet capital expenditure needs of IDR 500 billion in 2025, a 25% increase from 2024. The allocated funds will support fleet expansion (IDR 400 billion) and vessel maintenance (IDR 100 billion), aiming to strengthen the company's capital structure amid a positive industry outlook.

title: PT Chandra Asri Alkali to Build World-Scale Chlor-Alkali Plant in Indonesia with IDR 15 Trillion Investment
body: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (TPIA) is investing IDR 5.5-6.3 trillion (USD 350-400 million) to build a chlor-alkali ethylene dichloride plant in Cilegon, Banten, expected to be completed in 2027, which will reduce Indonesia's reliance on imports by IDR 4.9 trillion per year and potentially add IDR 5 trillion to the country's foreign exchange reserves annually. The plant will have a production capacity of 400,000 tons of solid caustic soda and 500,000 tons of ethylene dichloride per year, supporting the company's long-term organic growth strategy and contributing to Indonesia's economic growth.

title: Bank Indonesia Maintains Benchmark Interest Rate at 5.75% to Ensure Economic Stability and Control Inflation
body: Bank Indonesia has maintained its benchmark BI 7-day reverse repo rate at 5.75%, aiming to maintain domestic economic stability and growth, with inflation projections expected to remain around 2.5% in 2025 and 2026. The central bank has also kept its deposit facility rate at 5% and lending facility rate at 6.5%, with no changes to its benchmark interest rate since January 2025.

title: Indonesian Palm Oil Association, Earthworm Foundation, and Japbusi Launch Guideline for Sustainable Daily Worker Contracts in Palm Oil Industry
body: The Indonesian Palm Oil Association (GAPKI), Earthworm Foundation, and Japbusi launched a guideline for daily worker contracts in the sustainable palm oil sector, aiming to improve labor practices, ensure fair wages, and support long-term business sustainability. The guide is expected to help companies comply with Indonesian labor laws, improve workers' welfare, and contribute to the nation's economy, with the palm oil industry being a significant sector in terms of labor absorption and foreign exchange generation.

title: Indonesia Unveils 20-Year Roadmap for Palm Oil Downstreaming Program to Boost Economic Growth and Self-Sufficiency
body: The Indonesian government has designed a 20-year roadmap for palm oil downstreaming, aiming to generate higher and more sustainable economic growth through four stages, including strengthening industrial ecosystems and increasing global competitiveness. With Indonesia controlling 68.7% of global palm oil production, the program is expected to increase demand and support national energy self-sufficiency, food self-sufficiency, and environmental protection, ultimately driving economic growth.

title: Indonesian Oleochemical Producers Hope to Expand Global Palm Oil Market through BRICS Membership
